author: {'steamid': '76561198049573186', 'num_games_owned': 653, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1610152014}
review:
This game is a gem.

First of all, the music is probably the best part and what makes it so enjoyable. It's amazing. Without it, the gameplay might get a little repetitive. But it's just so dang fun to fly across the galaxy listening to Kyoto Connection.

I wish there was a little more variety in the quests, though. Every once in a while you do some random mini game or you get to go down onto a planet, but then never again. It'd be awesome if you could explore not just the universe but the planets themselves as well. Still, I really enjoyed the story and the emphasis on exploration. You have tons of options on how you want to play the game: trading merchant, bounty hunter, scavenger, pirate, postman... and there's so many different kinds of ships suited to your fancy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966778569', 'num_games_owned': 917, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1561870499}
review: An awesome mix of adventure, shooting and exploring with a healthy dose of 80s style and pixelated goodness. 3030 Deathwar Redux is an open world space game similar to the likes of games like Elite, Freelancer, X3 and others, but with a greater focus on story, a simplicity in design and accessibility in gameplay. It's sort of like taking the 2D side-scrolling adventures coupled with top down shooters and mashing it together in perfect harmony. There's mining, bounty hunting, delivery missions and all the staples of the typical open universe space game. A definite purchase if you like that sort of thing and want a more relaxed, casual (yet still engaging) version of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275116141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1616468936}

review:
It's a hidden little gem of a space trade game that has a bit of the feel of VANGERS when it comes to combat and control. 

When you're not interested in the short story - there's a lot to do in the sector - mining, hunting people, hunting pirates, photographing, delivering stuff... It's a neat little timewaster of a game. Nothing grand, nothing big, it's just the right size to pick up for a while and get lost in it. 

It should be noted that half of the fun is the OST which is pretty damn fitting for the setting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022259189', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1046, 'last_played': 1650708592}
review:
A fun little indie game, with some pretty good music, its a shame theres so few of them. 

It took me a few days to grind my way up to the very best freighter/bulky ship (that I could find anyways) It wasn't the most expensive or the most offensive but it was very beefy and had the largest cargo hold, I found mining to be the quickest way to grind up if you followed market prices. 

I never finished the storyline as I got so caught up in side quests, exploring every star and doing scavenging and mining operations. 

It's good, not perfect, it could use more things to do, and some of the quests are really annoying and confusing at times, but overall a good decent little game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017896830', 'num_games_owned': 587, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1569380275}
review: Cool game with interesting 2D layout love it

author: {'steamid': '76561198065872593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1663341513}
review:
Gioco davvero meraviglioso. Un combinato di space sim, avventure "punta e clicca" e grafica retrò che coinvolge. Sembra di giocare a Elite Dangerous o Star Citizen ma come se fossero stati realizzati negli anni '90 dalla Lucas Arts.

Geniale. La storia principale è abbastanza profonda e a tratti ricorda le emozioni provate in INDIANA JONES E IL DESTINO DI ATLANTIDE o MONKEY ISLAND. Decisamente accattivante nella seconda metà del suo arco narrativo, la storia diventa frizzante soprattutto quando [spoiler]Falcon scenderà su un pianeta per la prima volta[/spoiler]. Ecco, in quel momento, ho provato le stesse sensazioni dei due giochi sopra menzioni.

Ad ogni modo, ciò che conta è che si ha la massima libertà d'azione per fare QUALSIASI COSA si voglia. Minare asteroidi, commerciare, trasportare persone o cargo, fare bounty-hunting, esplorare l'universo e le nebulose. Insomma, ce n'è per tutti i gusti.

Piccolo capolavoro indie che davvero getta nuova linfa al genere Sci-Fi, rivista in questa chiave del tutto che scontata che, se giocata come si deve, può regalare ore e ore di pure divertimento e sano coinvolgimento.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198007822217', 'num_games_owned': 1510, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 1403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1567981909}
review: An open space trading and combat game with a plot of sorts.  If you like Freelancer and the like you will probably enjoy this.  I know I do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055928294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 842, 'last_played': 1561306353}
review:
This is a cool and somewhat addictive game. The look and feel is excellent, the gameplay is intuitive and the characters are fun. Buy a flying saucer (small, fast and turns on a dime) do delivery / taxi missions and buy weapon upgrades when you can. You'll soon be destroying the most wanted pirates with ease. The plot is OK, but I ditched it at an early point so I can't really say much about it. The above said, this game does need some serious rebalancing. 

The space-derelict salvaging portion of the game is not cost effective. I went through a bunch of derelicts and filled up 100 tons of cargo slots. It got me a bit over 10,000 credits - you can easily get three or more times that from normal missions. Commodity trading and asteroid mining are similarly lack-luster. The nebula map is worthless. You can (and should) just use the radar and the artistic drawing of the nebula clouds. Spaceship weapons and upgrades overpower the value of the ships themselves. You can put the biggest weapon and shield generators on tiny ships which leaves you very little incentive to buy expensive ships. 

In summary, well worth the price I paid but not a game I could see playing for weeks on end.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991825315', 'num_games_owned': 2780, 'num_reviews': 696, 'playtime_forever': 2308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1650725180}
review:
There arent many good space sims. This is by far one of the best ones out there. The aesthetics are great. Yes, its a small indie game, but its filled with love and some great work.

Pros:
-Plot is nice
-great aesthetics
-Space sim is interesting
-lots of ways to make dough

Cons:
-Trade simulation is not a system, but handcrafted numbers
-Salvaging ships is interesting but feel repetitive
-Ship to ship combat is not very well fleshed out
-gun combat does not work very properly
-Had some frame lag in some parts of the game(later on planets)

Aesthetics:
This is a great looking game, full of eastereggs, visually interesting places, and great character design. Nothing is 'forced' or ugly, its all nice. Some stations do feel repetitive and you will see that some stations look just like other staions on the inside. On the outside, each station looks unique and interesting, its sad that the interiors and characters inside just feel as repetitive as any other station.

Combat:
Every ship has the same AI. Battles will end up feeling a bit repetitive, but you do need to destroy some enemies, it also gives you plenty of cash if you capture live pirates, so you can just target pirates and go looting their cargo or just bounty hunting. 

Trading:
It consists basically of finding where stuff is sold low and bought high, market doesnt fluctuate or is a complete simulation. Wish the trading part of the game were a little bit deeper or that you could create a trading company, set routes and have a fleet(or hired guards).


Gameplay loop:
Do delivery and taxi missions, get a freighter to buy and sell cargo whenever you stop or after you sell clocked missions. Most combat you will just avoid unless you get a bounty mission, those reward a lot of cash. Also dont forget to buy upgrades, they are essential.


Review:
This is a great open world game, its not 'procedural' or a full on simulation. it doest emulate the best of space out of many games i have seen so far, many focus on the combat or other ship elements, but they all forget about the ambience and aesthetics of space, its plot and visuals will show you how well crafted this has been

An essential game for anyone that likes space games, just dont expect to stay in this game for too long.
7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198018668276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2184, 'last_played': 1560909960}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970876965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1564924336}
review:
This is a game where you have a loose plot but have the option to explore. You start with a very basic ship but there are lots of expansion options and other ships to try out.
The game has cute retro graphics and you can carry passengers places or parcels or focus on pirate hunting. There are a number of ways to earn a living.
Highly recommended due to the endless possibilities and great fun.

review:
의외로 컨텐츠가 없습니다;;;;;;;;;;;;;;

소개영상이나 리뷰를 보면 뭐가 좀 있을거같은데 히든 요소도 거의 없고
당장 폐선 탐사만 해도 들어가서 좀 흝고 나오는 1만 캐쉬 상당의 물건이 보통 끝입니다.(좋은 배 한대에 500만 넘는데말이죠 ㅡㅡ)

무기라고 해봐야 위력 좀 더 세진 직선 무기일뿐이고 그에 따라 달리는 부수 디바이스가 많지만 전부 업그레이드형이라 실제로 많지도 않습니다.

우주선이 많아 보이는데 실제로는 50종이 안됩니다. 특성도 고만고만하고요.
개인적으로 1.6만짜리 게임은 절대 아니네요.

OST는 극찬합니다만..(OST가 아니고 레트로풍 음악들중 섭외한거같지만요)

author: {'steamid': '76561197966590884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2999, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 710, 'last_played': 1688003782}
review:
Short but solid top-down space flight, trading, and combat game.

Probably my favorite approach to the combat element of any game in this genre I've seen. Usually I expect combat in this style to be a painfully awkward slugging match that tests which ship has the highest stats rather than rewarding handling skill to any great degree. I wouldn't say 3030 Deathwar's combat is [i]great[/i], but it does manage to be engaging and even satisfying at times. Especially when you realize that you can perform micro-warp maneuvers to help dodge and approach enemies.

Long-distance travel is also superior in its genre. Rather than instantly teleporting between star systems, you maintain direct control the entire way, with increasingly efficient time-dilation as you travel further from systems and hazards. The result is that you aren't taken out of the game as much during long voyages and you keep that atmosphere of exploration and mild loneliness in the vastness of space.

The excellent soundtrack and awesome visual effects also help keep lengthy trips fun.

The story is by far the weakest part. The writing is bafflingly awkward and the plot is extremely superficial. But it's not obnoxious, and even has some fun moments of self-awareness and visual humor. You can safely ignore it most of the time, including after completing the story which does not require more than a few hours if you focus on it exclusively.

The graphics look dated. In the space-travel segments, which are most of the gameplay, they are more charming, and even gorgeous at parts. The adventure game-ish segments where your character walks around space stations or other environments are much rougher, but not necessarily awful depending on your taste.

My biggest disappointment is just that there's not more content to this game. I'd like to explore a setting and story as vast as, say, Escape Velocity: Nova just with these flight mechanics, visual style, and music.

So I think that works out to a positive recommendation, even a strong one. I'd say it's easily worth picking up for $5-10. Higher than that and you might want to make sure you're really going to be into its particular gameplay and visual style, but still worth investigating.

Very happy to have played this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057334156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 872, 'last_played': 1559331428}
review:
At first I was blown away how nice the game is. For a while I was looking for a space game that fits the description of sandbox with exploration and space fight. As in some of other reviews I can confirm that there was a lot of thought put into this game... at least the first half. 

PROS:
- The game gradually introduces you into various game mechanics without holding your hand, which gives you that nice feeling of accomplishment so many titles are missing.
- Pretty nice range of ships to buy with some decent customization.
- Music is on a plus side but after few hours you may want to disable it... there is only so much you can listen to specific song ;P

CONS:
- As much as the start and mid game is fun, the end game seems to be missing something. I found myself looking at ship upgrade, and was unable to pinpoint a good way to earn money. Just trying to get 3.000.000 doing 20-30.000 missions (mining, delivery etc) means I have to do it 100 times... given I get max payout. Add some randomization = lower pay and it gets boring. The most expensive ship is 8.000.000 and there are no better ways to find money... so do the math
- Space battle may seems alright at the beginning but after a while I found it a broken system.
  -- missiles do little damage and you are limited to few (depending on the ship)
  -- projectile weapons scatter therefore you need to get close to get a decent DPS... with enemies literally teleporting around this gets quite annoying
  -- two ways to fight, that I found most enjoyable are; shot and fly where the mouse is pointing, but the huge downside is that you wont be able to strafe aside easily to avoid incoming fire, as such even the best shield with more than 1 enemy seems pointless. // you get a ship with turret and switch to keyboard and mouse control - you can move freely and hit the target but due to scatter you may miss majority of shots.

The main problem with this game is how the fighting is designed. To get the max damage you need to install weapon on turret and front (turret turns where you aim and front... always shots ahead of you DUH ;) This causes big problems later when neutral or friendly ships are around. Both guns shoot with one button so you find yourself quite often using turret while front is facing neutrals/friendlies - and accidently you are sharing some DPS with them as well. This in result agro friendlies on you and you need to pay fines at stations that initially welcome you back with friendly fire as well.

To sum up:
Game will definitely give you a lot of enjoyment. For the price, just getting 10 hrs of play is way worth it, but don't be surprised to get annoyed with end game. I had some fun but not feeling upset leaving this game half way. A lot of potential and will definitely try it again if they release a follow up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015821943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1559182600}
review:
Somewhere over the last twenty years, games have improved in almost every respect except they have often shirked gameplay in pursuit of all the other bells and whistles. This is a game that keeps the core of what keeps so many of us gaming in focus: good solid gameplay. It doesn't try to be anything that it isn't.

One reviewer I saw online equated this to a mash of Space Quest, Freelancer/Privateer, and Star Wars. Not sure about that last one, maybe I would substitute Subspace in there instead. Either way, it was absolutely as advertised in their great trailer. While the main story was short, if you messed around with the more open gameplay elements, trying out all the different jobs, playing moneyball, bounty hunting, mining, trading, exploring, bumping people outside a station, and a bunch of other random activities. If you tried all those along the way, the game certainly feels a lot fuller than rushing the story, which I think many people do.

I certainly wasn't expecting there to be so much optional content as there was. Definitely a ton of fun to be had in this title. 

+ Really fun gameplay
+ Comedic storytelling
+ Lots to do if you don't beeline the main story
+ Tons of upgrades/ship types that all help enhance the 'lots to do'
+ Awesome soundtrack
+ Great references to a ton of classic games
+ Price/content ratio is astronomical

- Not a ton of replayability, all the more reason not to rush the main story

Anyway, great game, highly recommended for people that grew up with Space Quest, Elite, Wing Commander Privateer, Freelancer, etc. Also highly recommended for just about anyone else looking for a casual game to have fun with that scratches the itch of a few different genres and really emanating a solid retro vibe.

Looking forward to seeing what else the developer decides to do. Great work.

PS: I found the ending hilarious.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976224458', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2012, 'last_played': 1559170120}
review:
* This game has lots of character, great music, good writing/dialogue consistent with it's campy sci-fi nature.  It is very consistent throughout which is great to see in an open world game.
* Combat is fun and messy at times.  It's easy to "get into the zone" and stay focused on it. I would like to have seen shield restore item (spark) use the same inventory mechanic as missiles.
* Needs a little more life in the mid to end-game: could use a bit more NPCs with more mini games/fleshing out in the distant sectors.  Moneyball was a nice touch!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990521072', 'num_games_owned': 667, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2004, 'last_played': 1558704427}
review:
Das Spiel macht wirklich sehr viel Spaß und in einer Zeit in der ich konstant das Spiel wechsel weil mir sehr schnell langweilig wird, macht 3030 Deathwar Redux wirklich enorm Spaß. Aber dies liegt vor allem an dem sehr passenden Mix. Es macht einfach Spaß.

Ich würde es gerne genauer erklären, aber mir fehlen hierzu die Worte.

Spiel ist gut für 10-20 Spielstunden, unter Umständen auch mehr. Es gibt nicht wirklich richtige Mods, die das Spiel groß erweitern. Aber der Kern ist sehr passend. Eine Erweiterung wäre perfekt. - Würde sofort kaufen. Dieses Spiel ist nach Freelancer einer meiner neuen Favoriten in der Kategorie Spacesimulations und Co.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093090628', 'num_games_owned': 726, 'num_reviews': 214, 'playtime_forever': 1170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 933, 'last_played': 1559077306}
review:
3030 Deathwar Redux - A Space Odyssey- одна из тех игр, которые однозначно сделаны с душой. В ней всё очень ламповое и как будто родное. Весь геймплей состоит в том чтобы летать по планетам, трейдиться, таксовать и воевать в космосе с пиратами(сразу вспоминается сега и денди). Есть возможность и самому стать пиратом, правда кроме всеобщей агрессии и неудобств с этого мало что можно поиметь.
На ваш вкус и цвет предлагается куча разных кораблей, каждый из которых хорошо подойдёт для тех или иных типов миссий, ну или не подойдёт вообще не для чего(самые дешманские корыта).
Очень порадовали космические фоны и эффекты полёта- сделано дёшево(очень просто), но сердито. Музыка отлично подходит для дальних "плаваний"- расслабляет и дарит хорошее настроение.
Очень расстроила продолжительность сюжета- он настолько короткий, что я искренне офигел- буквально пару полётов по планетам, пару загадок для детей и всё. Разработчики творили маленькой тимой- именно поэтому всего тааак мало, но работа проделана великолепная. Тем не менее, сам сюжет подан в стиле комических боевиков 90-х- это так же позволяет поностальгировать о былых временах.
Игра совершенно не напрягает, особенно когда разберёшься со всеми механиками. Прохождения по ней нет, поэтому если возникнут вопросы- с радостью отвечу на них в комментариях(или в друзья залетайте).
3030 DEATHWAR REDUX - A SPACE ODYSSEY заслуживает покупки даже по полной цене- в отличие от всяких зажравшихся ААА-проектов, где несмотря на имя, репутацию, количество кодеров и денег всё делается через одно место, не оптимизируется и вообще фу, эта игра сделана С ДУШОЙ. А это однозначно стоит благодарности разрабам, ведь они подарят вам действительно приятные воспоминания о коротком, но весёлом и ламповом путешествии в космосе.

[h1] Залетайте на саундклауд- там песни моей музыкальной группы в отличном качестве и бесплатные для скачивания, Карл. Я буду рад, если вы найдёте время послушать хотя бы одну, ведь мы старались!
https://soundcloud.com/tms_trap_music/tracks [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197984425692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1558148888}
review:
This game instantly drew me in but hasn't run out of surprises yet. It's one of the weirdest experiences because I start to say "I wish this game had...." and before I know it I quickly find out that it's actually a feature of the game.

So much heart and thought went behind every idea in this game. Nothing seems half baked and it's apparent that during the development they took the time to test every process. It's so fluid and intuitive. Every action seems to have some sort of QOL feature already built in.

I'm still early in the game and as a new player my only annoyances are the fact that I can't save during a mission and despite the controls being easy to learn there seems to be extra steps that aren't needed. For instance to dock at a location I have to press Q -> Tab -> 1. Which doesn't matter in the grand scheme of things.

If you have played anything similar to Freelancer (you have a ship, make money in any way you want, find cool shit, become a god) then you will absolutely like this. 

Added bonus: The music is simply amazing. You can set what soundtracks to use and when the game switches songs. I was getting annoyed that I would be jamming to an amazing song while flying but it switched songs whenever I docked. Well guess what. There is a setting so that it doesn't do that. I simply love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998410009', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1224, 'last_played': 1557242177}
review:
As all of the other non positive reviews said, there is NOT enough content to justify how long this game has been in development.
       I would recommend endless sky instead..... the real kicker being, it doesn't cost anything... But has more content.... and is EXACT SAME STYLE GAME, just with loads more freedom.


 If a dev reads this and can't figure out what I mean by not enough content: I mean that every single derelict has the EXACT same layout, as well as every single station (Because TINY random gened spaces are "such" a pain to make now days....)  
 The pricing for trade goods does not fluctuate enough to make trading doable.
     You can't start a fleet of any kind, and while you can get assistance from other rando ships, you will NEVER have a trade empire.


    
  
ALSO a really really big side note.... Ive visited EVERY SINGLE SYSTEM in this entire game and am flying an unkillable 2mil credit ship......... After 20 hours..... with no cheats..... on my first run. NOT ENOUGH CONTENT>


Leaving original review intact as I still stand by it. response to the dev: I would love if this game expanded, it's not bad, it's just basic, and has very little content for the style of game it is.
    I have been watching for mods for it, but there really isn't allot there.
That DOSN'T mean I won't buy a new game produced by you guys.
     I just think this could have ALLOT more to it, and maybe the base game was flawed from the start. 
   If that is the case, then make your own game, from scratch. Use the spark of 3030, and make something outstanding. I would prolly buy it.
developer_response:
Hi Zypher,

we can't write a full history here, but the "10 years in the making" was meant as a thankyou to those that supported us, and showing that this is a project of long-term dedication. The core of the game was coded more than 10 yrs ago, then after a long gap of maybe 7 or 8 yrs, we started work on a fresh updated version which improved the game a huge amount. All the time this has been a part time project and the remaining very old code has limited what would have been possible with modern engines.

Since full release we have continued to add more content and opened up modding to allow more content to be added in future. We are sorry you were disappointed by the game. This was a very long-term passion project for us, and we only hoped to bring people joy with it. Perhaps as additional features or modding work is done you'll give the game another try and enjoy it better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983487892', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1294, 'last_played': 1637703456}
review: Surprisingly addictive and entertaining. Its old school charm is enhanced by the fact that it game quite self-consciously a loving tribute to the point-and-click adventures and arcade shooters from the golden years of these genres. It recalls a time when game designers, artists and writers could turn a simple concept into a sweeping story where players could lose themselves for minutes or hours at a time. Quirky dialogue and a fantastic soundtrack makes it a pleasure to play. Missions are rewarding and encourages exploration which becomes a leisurely backdrop for the scripted story to unfold. Always find myself coming back for more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154827452', 'num_games_owned': 383, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1592734089}
review: I couldn't be happier about getting this game. This is hands down one of the most beautiful and entertaining games I've played in a very long time. The soundtrack for this game is just gorgeous! The amount of love that has gone into the making of this game is evident the moment you start playing. The attention to detail is simply amazing. I love how thought has been given to many aspects of "outer space" - like nebulas having ionizing effects, a "shadow" falling behind your ship diametrically opposite the sun in the middle when you are within a solar system... Being a hardcore fan of this genre of games, I'm simply loving the gameplay experience. The only thing that irks me is the fact that you can't save the game and quit when a mission is active...

author: {'steamid': '76561197970346749', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2262, 'last_played': 1556672096}
review:
Really satisfying game. Not terribly hard, but lots of fun to explore and play with the various ship/weapon combinations. Let's you just sort of zone out while you explore the galaxy, annihilate pirates and build your wealth!

I also really enjoy the developer's sense of humor in the writing/descriptions. Fun game! Worth the $$.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960846689', 'num_games_owned': 1500, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1092, 'last_played': 1556113289}
review:
This is one of the best games EVER! Witty, funny dialogues, a great parody on classical cliche stories, pirates, taxi jobs, trading, ship upgrades, killer droids and other things that we all long for in every space game.
The 8-bit style is great and works very well for this game.
It deserves an A+++, BUY IT!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198078297005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2201, 'last_played': 1680489254}
review:
A really fun game; I just wish there was more to it! I love space exploration games, as well as open-world adventure. This delivers both, though it sometimes feels like a tease, as if there should be more to explore and greater variation in missions. In some ways, this feels almost like a demo that only lets you see a little bit of what the game can deliver.

Graphics and Sound:
The retro graphics look great, as well as the ship designs; many of which look like cars retrofitted for space travel. The overall look and feel of the game is fantastic, and it is a world you want to explore more of. Unfortunately, due to a "quarantine" written into the story, you can only visit the bar and job consoles inside each station and are only given a tease as to to what the rest looks like. Every station feels exactly the same really quickly, with just a few minor scenery changes, which gets old. You can talk to the other patrons, but as few have any sort of side-quest for you (and these are extremely short), the amount of interesting dialog dries up really fast. I admit, I do like that the occasional character looks like Kryten from Red Dwarf, and you'll sometimes get a bar droid that looks exactly like Crow from Mystery Science Theatre 3000. The sound effects are fitting, but what really stands out is the soundtrack. While in space the game often plays random songs by The Kyoto Connection; a highly underrated band (I bought one of their albums just because of this game), which adds another level of atmosphere.
Controls and Combat:
I use an X-Box controller and found the controls both fluid and easy to memorise. However, as some reviewers have already mentioned, the space combat is extremely easy. I used a plasma cutter, which you can purchase fairly early. And though it has a short range, it can shred an enemy ship in a matter of seconds. When on board stations, or the very brief scene where you can actually go planet-side, your character moves on a two-dimensional plane and there are only a couple times when you need to use your gun. It's very simple, but not bad. Though like the space combat, it lacks in difficulty.
Gameplay and Missions:
As this is an open-world game, you are not required to follow the main story plot at all. And even if you do, you can still continue playing even after you've beaten the main game. However, for being open-world, the main plot is extremely linear and fairly easy to beat. Honestly, it can be finished in about an hour and was really anti-climactic. A shame, because the dialog, especially between the villains, is often witty and hilarious. Some reviewers have complained about the excessive profanity, but honestly, I thought it added to the humour. I do like being able to explore derelicts and mine asteroids, which can earn you funds to upgrade your ship; plus you can haul passengers or parcels to various stations for cash. Shooting of space junk is also a means of earning a small stipend. However, once you've beaten the main game and / or maxed out all your ship upgrades, it quickly gets repetitive.
Characters:
While the main protagonist, John Falcon, has a decent story, the secondary characters are lacking. There is a short side-plot involving Kent the robot, which is entertaining, yet once it's finished, you don't interact with Kent at all anymore; he just follows you around the station. A shame, because he has some really funny dialog. And the other main character, Vasquez (her first name is never given) does almost nothing. You see her a couple times, yet after she links up with you again towards the end of the main story, you have zero interaction with her.
Overall:
3030 Deathwar is a fun game that I do recommend, just keep your expectations realistic. As it was made by a small, independent company, I'm not expecting a vast world with hundreds of open-ended side stories, i.e. "Then Elder Scrolls in Space" (hmm, Bethesda should make that!). The retro graphics, excellent soundtrack, and great visual ambiance are what gives it replay value. The controls are also excellent and make for a solid gameplay experience. The paper-thin plot and tasks that become repetitive very quickly don't necessarily detract, they just leave you wanting more. This is a game I would actually like to see some DLC; more quests, a larger and more varied universe to explore, more characters with meaningful interaction, and access to the rest of each station. If the devs made a DLC with these upgrades, I'd buy it in a heartbeat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067727504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1232, 'last_played': 1577673388}
review: Late 1990's nostalgia with an amazing soundtrack.  Great game. Fun, repetitive, but in a way that makes you feel like you're the master of the universe because you know exactly what your doing after the 100th time doing it. (not sarcastic) This game is engaging, exciting and relaxing all at the same time.  If you're even curious about this game, just buy it... it's a great game. I have had more satisfaction from this game than most AAA games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004558343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 962, 'last_played': 1555155469}
review:
For 10 supposed years of work put into it there sure as shit isn't 10 years worth of story.
If you only do the story missions you could complete this game in just over an hour, probably less. There are only 10 or so songs that play while flying around and maybe 5 royalty free songs that play in the space stations. What is supposed to be the best part of the game: flying from place to place and doing missions, starts to feel like your acting as a space truck driver while listening to your friends shitty mix tape that you listen to out of desperation because you somehow managed to break the radio but not the cd player. 
There are absolutely no adventure staples to this game; no choices to make, no side characters to talk to in any meaningful way, the closest it comes to a puzzle is a line unscrabler, and the ending felt like a joke (and not in a good way)
[spoiler] The final battle is against a mothership that's barely bigger than the cargo freighter you can get at endgame and can be beaten with absolutely no difficulty. The final confrontation with the big bad dude that's been hyped up the entire game is ended with a singe key press. It was underwhelming and felt like the rug had been pulled out from under me[/spoiler] 
There are a lot of problems with this game that drag it down for me and although I cant say my money was wasted I can say that I feel my time was. Pick this game up on sale if you really really need a mindless space sim to zen out to while playing your own music but if your looking for a scifi adventure game like I was look elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078635561', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1586043410}
review:
Hey... hey you... yes, i mean you, sir. Yes, yes, stop scrolling! You look like one of those synth-loving-spaceship-veterans-of-the-old-school... am-i-right? You know the hidden thruth that space is not empty and black but a colorful place filled with neon-lightened stuff that beeps, buzzes and sizzles. You know that space is burstling with life of all kinds like speaking slugs, space-bar-robots and humans that never take off their spacesuits and many many more. And you know all you want is being amidst all of this, cruising your fancy spaceships direction sunset while your consoles flash in the rythm of synthwave! Soooo, why are you still here?!? Go go go, get your ticket to the fun!!

What? You ask me why i am not doing Review Meta? My 8/10th or 2/11th? That's easy to answer: This game looked at the planet called "Meta", grinned, turned the key of it's 9999 megaton liquid fuel boosted super rocket around, pierced a hole in the planet's atmosphere and pushed it to the other side of the galaxy on it's lightspeed fast journey to the next universe! ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197992911206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1549490192}
review:
The game has its fun parts, but all in all, there just isn't a lot to do.

The missions are fun for less than an hour, after a while I just accepted bounty missions, or killed pirates without missions. The battles aren't very hard, but at least more fun than taxi or delivery jobs. The story isn't really interesting, dropped out of that after a while.

Most frustrating is the fact, that "friendly fire" immediatly makes every friendly attack you. There are this events, where giant battles between police and pirates take place, where you are supposed to help out. But a single friendly fire hit makes all police try to kill you. Meanwhile, the police keeps friendly firing non stop...

Salvaging, the thing the story tries to tell you to do, is really boring and not really worth it. In comparison, everything but bounty hunting just didn't seem worth it money wise...

The story also doesn't acknowledge it, when you found the one ship you're supposed to be looking for. And you're supposed to enter it multiple times, which the game doesn't tell you. So I've found the ship on my first salvage by chance and ignored it, until it disappeard. Since I didn't have much cargo space on my ship, it was absolutly worthless.

There also is this "interesting" idea of "money ball". Apperently an illegal and dangerous game, which should be a good opportunity to make money. Well, you get almost no money out of it, it's really boring, and the first few times, I killed everyone, because I didn't understood the goal. That was, by the way, far more lucrative than playing, and also legal, since everyone there has a bounty in that game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005366749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 790, 'last_played': 1536092027}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993189274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1553218982}
review: Enjoyed this indie space game, which reminded me a lot of Escape Velocity: Nova. Has a real nostalgic 90's feel to it. You can make money by mining asteroids, shooting bad guys, exploring derelict ships and/or trading goods across the galaxy. The plot is probably too linear - I would have enjoyed some more side quests, and I never really felt challenged by the combat (Moneyball, on the other hand...).

author: {'steamid': '76561197975665802', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1591249971}
review: 3030 in a nutshell: Sierra's Space Quest meets Elite: Dangerous. It is surprising in a way that most big space games (X4, Elite, SC, etc.) focus on the sandbox elements, but lack in story. Star Citizen is attempting to turn that around with Squadron 42, but it is anyone's guess how good that will turn out. 3030 fills a very particular niche in that it tries to combine lots of similar gameplay elements but with more plot. Hopefully we'll see additional graphic adventure elements in the future. Great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197966343267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 951, 'last_played': 1662358433}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002259554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3759, 'last_played': 1620639812}
review:
[ENGLISH]
Hi there! Beta tester Axl RAID here.

This game is some kind of blend between Space Top Down Shooter and a Point & Click feeling when aboard stations and some other scenes (when outside the ship in short).

The OST is very nice & original and above all the devs are more than nice people.
Just for this last statement 3030DWR - ASO deserves your money even when not on sale.

OK I'm the credits so my opinion isn't totally objective but it is when I say this game is a good game.
The last update added a lot a new stuff and when you know that even before it was good, now it is best as ever.

Believe me when I say that the devs are nice people.
3030 Deathwar Redux is a game made with love. Love for Videogames and love for gamers. Just try it and you'll feel it.

If you're in this kind of games you should appreciate this one, I bet it. Just click that "BUY" button.

[FRANçAIS]
Salut! C'est Axl RAID des beta testeurs.

Ce jeu est un genre de mélange entre Top Down Shooter spatial et une ambiance Point & Click lorsque vous êtes dans les stations et certaines autres scènes (quand vous n'êtes pas dans le vaisseau en bref).

La bande son est aussi top qu'originale et par dessus tout les devs sont des types plus que supers.
Rien que pour ce dernier point 3030DWR - ASO mérite votre argent, même à plein tarif.

OK je suis dans les crédits donc mon avis n'est pas tout à fait objectif mais il l'est quand je vous dit que ce jeu est un bon jeu. La dernière mise à jour vient de rajouter une tonne de nouveau contenu et quand on sait qu'avant c'était déjà un bon jeu, maintenant il est encore meilleur que jamais.

Croyez moi quand je vous dit que les devs sont des gens biens.
3030 Deathwar Redux est un jeu fait avec amour. Avec l'amour des jeux vidéo et l'amour (platonique je vous rassure) des joueurs. Un jeu développé par et pour les joueurs en somme. Essayez le et vous le sentirez très vite.

Si vous aimez ce genre de jeu alors vous devriez apprécier celui-là, j'en fais le pari. Cliquez juste sur ce bouton "ACHETER".

author: {'steamid': '76561197964678966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2936, 'last_played': 1552852271}
review:
Was fun for the first few hours but after that it got boring. Lot of potential but after a while very little to do. Missions are repetitive and all stations are the same. Also the story was surprisingly short.

Hint. Get turret and Ion Cannon. It's all you ever need.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079530646', 'num_games_owned': 457, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1552678221}
review:
I'm done with this game, I've had enough of it. Missions are repetitive and monotonous. There are too many delivery boy type of missions and combat is lackluster and basic. There are no choices to be made in the main story, thus super linear. Talk to person A in star system X, go to system Y thereafter and talk to person B at a similar looking space station to progress with the story, rinse and repeat. 

This is not something that immediately strikes you within a 2 hour time frame. This game gives you a false sense of a large galaxy with plenty of things to do. So much potential, but it falls flat on its face once you get familiar with the gameplay loop and game features. Cool music and retro graphics though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023550695', 'num_games_owned': 495, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1558996937}
review:
Ein sehr unterhaltsamer Titel! Trotz seiner technischen Einfachheit bietet es eine ungeahnte Spieltiefe!

Du stehst auf Weltraumerkundung und deinen Weg im All zu finden, um dein Schiff auszubauen und Aufträge aller Art zu erledigen? Dann ist dies genau dein Spiel!

Du stehst auf klassische Point and Click Erzählungen und eine Story, die die Atmosphäre des Spiels trägt? Dann findest du, genau diese Elemente in diesem Spiel!

Egal, ob man hier nun der Story folgt oder erstmal damit beschäftigt ist, sich ein besseres Schiff zu erwirtschaften, es bleibt immer genug zu tun, sodass einem so schnell nicht langweilig wird!

author: {'steamid': '76561197985623328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1552300377}
review: Does not have rebindable controls.
developer_response:
Hey Katharta,

we're sorry to hear you were disappointed by the controls. We are only a tiny team of three developers, and had to constantly decide which things to focus on. Rebindable controls are a huge amount of work in a custom engine like this, so we would've had to cut a lot of content from the game to get that in instead. 

I hope you can understand the decision, and I hope you still enjoyed the game a lot!

author: {'steamid': '76561197976452525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 979, 'last_played': 1549615124}
review:
"Streamlining" has become a dirty word to me.  Not like "moist" or "turgid,"  but because that's what developers usually say when they take all the creative stuff out of a game so they can try to sell it to more people.

Sometimes it's not a bad thing, though.
 
Imagine how terrible this little game could have been if they had clogged it up with a lot of complex controls, "realistic" features and obstacles between you and the fun.  Here, there's no screwing around. You just hop in your ship, stomp the gas pedal and go.   Living the space life has never been so easy!

There's a lot of different stuff to do in order to progress and upgrade your ship: play the story missions, deliver packages, hunt pirates, enter races, shoot at space junk, haul trade goods, etc. You can pretty much do anything in less than 5 minutes.  It all feels quick and intuitive and doesn't waste your time, which I really appreciated.  It's probably tough to strike a balance like that in one of these open-world, Freelancer-style space sims which are usually geared more toward depth and complexity.

The story fits right in with this breezy little world.  It's funny and silly, and they play around with all the usual space cliches on purpose; but on the other hand it's still a real story, and not just a bunch of dumb pop culture references trying to be snarky and clever.  They walk pretty close to the fourth wall sometimes but never completely break character, so you stay invested.
  
Hell, even just flying around feels great.  The way they transition between your warp drive (or whatever it's called) and your normal speed as you move within and between systems is so seamless and nimble.
  
Man, I can't get over this.  It's like these guys actually want you to enjoy playing their game.

Imagine that!



You can find more indie game reviews at [url=https://oddlittlegames.com] oddlittlegames.com [/url] or visit my [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34514756/] curator page. [/url]  Thanks, and enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004536710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1671, 'last_played': 1551662431}
{'steamid': '76561198132460937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 2674, 'last_played': 1712105799}
review:
If you love space based games; 3030 Deathwar Redux is for you!  This game is a top down 2D space game, but checks every other box we all love in these types of games. Plenty of jobs, and missions to choose from such as your standard currier runs, delivery jobs, taxi runs, timed runs for more $$, survalence, assassinations, picture taking missions, towing objects through space, black market, working with gangsters, and much much more, Plenty of darelects to plunder you can actually enter ships to find goodies, and save any survivors while also bringing back the bodys. If you prefer, you can find asteroid fields to fire up your mining lasers and sell metals on the market. And, you can also buy low, and sell high; 3030 offers an active trade market with plenty of goods to invest in. All this to make money, and buy better ships, and more powerful upgrades. Oh, can't forget mentioning pirates, and plenty of other bad guys who simply want you dead.

This game has a solid story line you can jump in and out of. The Devs have really created a deep space adventure here. 
This one is a true gem of a well crafted game. Be prepared to be fully emerced, with many hours that will fly by. Very difficult to stop playing 3030 Deathwwar Redux. Fave fun!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197997355470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1546766417}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041730506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1552933464}
review:
As a huge Escape Velocity Fan I can definitely recommend this!

While the story is quite good, the side missions can get repetitive.

If you want a unique interaction with a character it can sometimes take a few trips to different space stations to find someone who has anything more than filler dialogue to say, which can be frustrating sometimes.

The music is A+ and the customization options for the in-game music keeps the game interesting.

Would recommend to anyone who enjoys RPG or space-mercenary games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198098661713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1549262116}
review:
Basically this game could be the major title for this entire genre, but it's like, just ugly. Not unforgivable during space flight, but most of the game is spent in space stations trying to navigate between a million 8 bit NPC's at a fucking 2cm wide space-bar. Actually yea, I bet you could make this game better just by spacing (hyuck) the NPC's out at the bar. Anyway... buy it on sale if you think the price is worth a couple (2) hours of play.

There is mod support! But hardly any have been made... pity I guess.
developer_response:
Hi GetBrocolli,

we're sorry to hear you didn't enjoy the game.

We have gathered a lot of feedback, through testing, forums, Discord and of course Steam reviews. The spacing of characters at bars was never mentioned before, so I'm not sure what the issue there is. You can actually turn down the moving speed on stations if you find it difficult to talk to certain characters. You might also be accidentally talking to the bar droid (happens to all of us), so just wait a second for them to move out of the way.

As for the 2 hours of gameplay, I'd just like to mention that most players are reporting 10-15 hours for completing the main storyline, and easily twice or three times that if you enjoy exploring the universe and earning money for top end ships and equipment.

It would be great if you could give the game another shot with those changed settings. Please let us know what you think!

All the best,
Max, Matt and Mike

author: {'steamid': '76561198099614863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 1377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1556843347}
review:
3030 Deathwar Redux is similar to the Flatspace games, but this has a lot more depth and an actual plot to follow. 3030 DR has plenty of charm, and the graphics are good enough for what it is. Progression is fairly quick, there's plenty of upgrades to weapons and systems, and there's a great variety of ships to buy.

I got it on sale and I feel like I got my money's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302327860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1322, 'last_played': 1549587790}
review:
It doesn´t matter how many times it had been said yet, I say it again:
- MAGNIFICENT RETRO LOOK
- FUNNY CHARACTERS AND DIALOGUES
- BEST FITTING SOUNDTRACK IMAGINABLE
- ENTERTAINING ACTION AND STORYLINE 
- VARIOUS MISSIONOBJECTIVES 

If you really like old fashioned games, or at least those how apparently look old fashioned, than this is a must have and absolutely recommended. Its beauty is in its simplicity. Just starting out from a station, waiting for the next song to start from that fantastic soundtrack and looking forward to fulfill the next mission is what it´s all about, time after time after time. 
No stupid inventions or over-ambitious features that prove the developer´s insanity, just no unnecessary crap.
3030 Deathwar Redux ia a solid, down-to-earth game which is easily able to let the player dive into its heavily 80´s inspired atmosphere. All parts fit together perfectly. One of the best stress reliefs for the after-work hours.

Additional comment: While looking around in the internet about this game, I noticed how many people were talking about the music artists, especially Kyoto Connection. Their music in this game is only from one album. I would recommend anyone who likes it to check out the other albums. And by doing so also check Steve Finney and Kevin MacLeod. Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976381703', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1593257677}
review:
I really wanted to like this game. It had all the makings of a game I desperately want to play.
Sadly, 3030 Deathwar falls flat on its face.
It’s an extremely monotonous grind in which you find yourself in one reskinned solar system or space station after another doing the same 4 types of jobs for money. I tried to justify playing thinking the grind might be worth it, but characterization and story kind of petered out and the ships never got more fun or interesting. 
Despite the first scene alluding to a point click adventure style, that element of the game is virtually non-existent. 
Combat is extremely lackluster. There is no challenge whatsoever.
Dialogue is corny, boring, and it begs to be skipped.
All the controls are clunky and convoluted on a system that could’ve been streamlined so easily.

All in all, and despite a good soundtrack and intentions from the devs, I can’t recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121831135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1549237019}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003233400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1549355179}
review: Absolutely love this game, but begging for positive reviews pisses me off to no end.
developer_response:
Hi fieryace, 

3030 is a part time project by three devs. We noticed that we used to get a lot of people on our forums saying they really love the game but hardly anyone was leaving an actual review. We've been recommended by some other micro indie devs that it's important to remind people who like the game to review. I think you're right and our "reminding" is a little heavy handed. We'll tone this down in future. 

Sorry if you felt this was too pushy and annoying. Thanks for your feedback either way and we're super happy you love the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015661942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1656582975}
review:
3030 Deathwar is an excellent revival of classic top-down space sims like Escape Velocity. I say revival because unlike many "remake-like" games that hold their source material in overly-reverent regard, warts and all, 3030 breathes new life into the best and most exciting parts of the EV series and dumps everything that doesn't work.

The basics are still there: Start with bad ship and no money. Do jobs. Make money. Get better ship. Do more jobs. Make more money. Get better ship. Start hunting pirates for fun and profit. Start buying out the local market and flipping cargo for easy profit. Do some story missions and build your reputation. Get better ship. Shoot everything that makes eye contact. Demand tribute. Take over a planet or five. Get better ship. Own a personal galactic armada. You get the picture.

I've played a lot of Escape Velocity. I grew up with a Mac in my house, so Ambrosia SW games defined that era of PowerPC gaming for me (such as it was). There is a lot about that original gameplay loop that is drilled into my brain. 3030 updates virtually every one of the core mechanics to make this game feel modern and responsive, while retaining the massive open-universe do-what-you-want scope that made the original EV so enticing.

For instance, one specific detail that absolutely does it for me: in EV, the Bar was an interaction on nearly every station that let you meet weird characters and advance plot points. However, running on a 60 MHz Performa meant that most of the plot went down via text boxes. 3030 takes that underloved system and moves it front-and-center - each station has a fully interactive Bar with dozens (hundreds??) of looks, background characters, drinks, and dialogue trees. The end result is that you're not just making a binary choice with a block of ASCII or delivering the idea of a package to a rewards screen - you're meeting in a seedy, derelict dive with your contact for better-paying work. It's a huge boon for immersion and gameplay depth.

3030 is a winner across all the checkboxes that matter to me. The soundtrack is fantastic, the visuals are rich and almost elegant in self-imposed 90's low-memory-ugliness, there is an astounding amount of snappy dialogue hiding behind even mundane characters, the derelict EVA-suit mechanic makes exploration and looting feel compelling, extra-spatial nebula complicate the act of getting from point A to B just enough to keep you on your toes, there is a story with characters I almost immediately cared about, the options menu is so interesting as to warrant its own entry, and hot dang, it even manages to be funny without falling into farce or cringe. 

I will update this review as I get further into the endgame, but this game is an awesome surprise and scratches a long-forgotten itch. It sounds trite, but playing 3030 makes me laugh and smile. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088498264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1553371151}
review:
I bought this game cause it was heavily on sale and had very good User reviews (>95%). After finishing one of my other games I gave it a try. And why the hell not? 
To be honest at the beginning I was really confused what to do and what was going on. Just being in a space bar was overwhelming. Here a menu, here an other shortcut, ... Well it was just a game I had to get used to in the first hour. First I thought the fun part is talking to people at the bar but layer after layer I found out about more things to do. So this game is kind of like an onion ... and like ogres. You know they have layers too? 
Well nevermind back to the game. It basically has two kind of settings. Either you stay in a bar where you can take jobs, squash some bucks and buy stuff like upgrades for your ship, fuel, goods, etc or you can fly in one of the plenty star systems. When you are flying in space the game changes to a top-down view where you can gaze at the pixelated beauty of more or less busy parts of the infinite void. Here you can either shoot space junk, loot cargo, shoot pirates, get random trade offers or just travel around to amazing music. There is always stuff to do and it is totally up to you what you are doing with your time. So nobody is going to hold your hand big boi! 
Oh there is also a story going on which is quite good on its own. But well, for me the space exploring and pirate shooting is way more fun. Just don't get attached to your ship to much, you might like that fighter jet but ooooh boi is it bad for looting cargo. So much guns, so little space for diamonds...
After all I can really recommend this game. It's pretty unique with a great atmosphere and has kept me entertained for roughly 10 hours now. And that is more than most people can realistically offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010681732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1548715364}
review:
It's times like this I wish there was a middle grounds between absolute Yes and No.

I would recommend this game for certain people.

As for me, it just didn't entice me enough initially.

"Full" controller support = using the controller to move a mouse cursor for the menus.

Old school gameplay = the 'talking' cutscenes can not be sped up. The animation on the characters look terrible - even worse than the old school graphics that was trying to be emulated.

Space ports (the few I visited) look the same.

I might try this game out again down the road because I know that it is probably something that I could get into... but I think it takes an effort to get into as opposed to just something that can be immediately enjoyed.
developer_response:
Hi Stoned Fox,

we're sorry to hear you didn't enjoy the game out of the gate.

You can actually speed up the talking in cutscenes by either increasing the talk speed in the game options, or by left-clicking with mouse or hitting R3 on the controller.

We're always available on the forums or Discord if you have any other questions or feedback about the game!

The game actually has a whole lot to offer, if you give it a chance. We hope you can give it another shot :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197969661400', 'num_games_owned': 982, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1549418693}
review:
On the surface the game is a top-down space trading and combat game, like Escape Velocity or Endless Sky or a billion trillion other identical games. However, it has an unusual side-scrolling adventure game layer while the player disembarks their ship, showcasing a unique art style with a great deal of charm and character. The writing and design put the game ahead of the other space trading games on Steam, and the surly space drunks and bizarre aliens populating the game's run-down stations give the impression you're in a living, breathing universe.
On the negative side, the main character wears a fedora and looks like he should be reviewing frozen pizzas on YouTube rather than hunting bounties in the cold reaches of space. 
Never mind. Quality game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048910194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1655, 'last_played': 1547923617}
review:
Sadly this looks to be one of the increasingly common indie gems that doesn't get nearly the attention that it deserves. Deathwar delivers an eclectic mix of old school genres with a new school sensibility. Fans of the old Escape Velocity games will feel right at home, as will gamers who have enjoyed such titles as the original Elite and the excellent Space Rangers series.

I usually cringe at the term "modern classic," but it applies here. Deathwar is a great deal of fun and nostalgia for the money. The soundtrack alone is worth the asking price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012099749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 954, 'last_played': 1546400514}
review: I didn't expect to like this game. I usually can't really get the immersion in the 2D top-down space games. But this one makes up for it with a lived-in world, fun characters, visually distinctive ships, and the salvaging. Something about the salvaging drives home the feeling of just scraping by. Really enjoyed it. Great price. Recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018470558', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1344, 'last_played': 1547419358}
review:
Unbelievable quality to price ratio.
Game made with love and care. Amazing music, great atmosphere and playability. I can't remeber the time I actually read ALL the text. Srcipt is funny, pacing good. You can salvage, mine, bounty hunt, clean junk, run missions or just follow the story.
If you are into space this is a must have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042522212', 'num_games_owned': 2924, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 824, 'last_played': 1560725301}
review: A space simulator RPG, this game allows you to explore the cosmos and making a living any way possible, whether that be cleaning up space junk, delivering packages, running a taxi service, buy and sell on the station market, kill pirates or be a pirate the choice is yours which causes for a really immure experience and makes it seem like there is always something new to do if you get board fly people/packages back and fourth. What I like about this game is it's not very grindy and allows you to progress through the game at a quiet enjoyable pace. Upgrading guns and I always loved the joy getting a brand new ship that would allow me to make more money faster, even traveling between different systems is fun as you have to navigate to avoid solar winds to save on fuel. There is a story to follow but I found myself most of the time doing my own thing. This pixel art space RPG has a lot in common with Elite Dangerous and feels like a simple alternative to that game. This game was great for me to sit back and relax as the game has full controller support you don't have to be sitting at a desk and makes the game easy to relax in. Overall I think that this is an amazing game that I can casually launch sit back and enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039702061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4420, 'last_played': 1547613155}
review: I haven't had this much fun since 2077

author: {'steamid': '76561197971589114', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1217, 'last_played': 1542915542}
review:
This game is meh to good. Combines a bunch of different things that mostly work together. It's pretty much everything I want in a retro Privateer-style space sandbox and I don't mind the 2D plane. Reminds me of EV Nova in a good way.

That said, the combat does get pretty thin towards the endgame. Not remotely a dealbreaker but I didn't feel like replaying at all. Maybe mods add more but I can't be arsed.

The reason why this is a thumbs up review is personality: you can tell playing that a lot of love went into 3030 Deathwar and that's something that deserves supporting from gamers.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961123278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1555247740}
review: Really cool game. Its like a lite adventure game mixed with a space sim. You can fly around the galaxy hunting priates, salvaging derelicts, visiting space stations, talking to quirky people in some fantastic pixle art in the way you remember it from back in the day (or not if you're not old). All of this happens alongside an excellent soundtrack that accompanies whatever you're doing. Wish i'd heard of this game earlier. The reviews speak for themselves really. In this age where every playerbase of a game pretty much turns toxic due to whatever reasons, this is one of the few that really has sincere and genuinely high praises because it is just really awesome. If you like adventure games and spaceships, try it out. It wont take long for you to fall in love with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054715335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1165, 'last_played': 1558839927}

review: A charming love-letter to both old school adventure games and Escape Velocity type space sims. If you're thinking of buying it you'd almost definitely like it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045151682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 1515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1515, 'last_played': 1547101888}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049314329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1546180980}
review:
I had fun in the short time I had with this game, but ultimately I had to refund it. Manually saving requires you to abandon ALL missions you're currently on. I just can't understand that decision.

So I abandoned all my missions and hit up the refund page.

Amazing soundtrack though, definitely buying that.
developer_response:
Hey Mash Potato,

sorry to hear you didn't like the game's save functionality. We know it's a bit surprising at first, but players usually say it's not that bad once you know about it.

The game's actually pretty good, we hope you can give it another shot! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198029903975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1546141219}
review: This might be a good game, but the dialogue is so slow.
developer_response:
Hi SugarySnax,

thanks for sharing your thoughts.

There are two easy solutions if you want to read the text faster:
1) You can go to the game options and change the text speed to a higher setting. That will make the text quicker automatically.
2) You can manually skip any text you have read already. Simply hit A on the gamepad, or click the left mouse button if you are using that.

You can let us know on the forums or the Discord if you have any other problems!

author: {'steamid': '76561198334882359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1586904069}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972343623', 'num_games_owned': 860, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1546352459}
review:
Hier wird mitunter geschrieben, es sei besser als Elite Dangerous - ich kann das nicht beurteilen, da ich ED noch nicht gespielt habe, aber wenn Elite Dangerous noch flacher sein sollte, sollte man sich für das Geld doch lieber ne Pizza bestellen. Ich bestreite nicht, dass 3030 Deathwar nicht liebevoll gemacht ist, und es hat auch einen gewissen Charme. Aber beim Gameplay hört es dann auch schon wieder auf. 
Klar man kann verschiedene Missionen erledigen und machen was man will - das Todschagargument aller Freespace-A-Likes. Aber warum? Taxi fahren und Briefträger sein macht keinen Spaß, bringt nur Geld. Kopfgeld jagen ist mühseelig, da das Kampfsystem mäh ist. Mining und Trading sind kaum lukrativ, da man selbst mit einem Tading Ship nur so wenig Frachtraum hat, dass man kaum Gewinn generieren kann - jede Taxi-Mission bringt mehr ein als die beste Handelsroute.
Und dann die verschiedenen Schiffe - klar kann ich darauf sparen, aber wenn ich eines der kleinsten Schiffe für 30 000 Credits mit einer ordentlichen Wumme ausstatte, finde ich erst in den Millionen wieder ein Schiff, das damit konkurrieren kann. So ewig Geld zu farmen macht mir keinen Spaß. Im übrigen alles Dinge die beispielsweise in SPAZ besser funktionieren. Oder in Freespace.
Bleibt noch der 90er Adventure - Part: Hat bei mir leider auch nicht funktioniert. Die Grafik ist gar nicht meins - da sahen die Lucas Arts Adventures um Welten besser aus. Die Animationen sind richtiggehend schäbig. Und in den ersten 8 Stunden passiert zwar was aber weder mein Charakter noch die Spielwelt konnten wirklich gefallen - alles ziemlich generisch.
Fazit: Wer SPAZ oder Freespace oder sogar Elite Dangerous mag und sich nicht an den repetitiven Aufgaben stört, der kann im Sale schon mal einen Versuch wagen. Sonst würde ich eher abraten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047520843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1546340058}
review:
A very limited space trading adventure. Only for fans of Privateer and Freelancer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053233264', 'num_games_owned': 4530, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1217, 'last_played': 1593790428}
review:
I’m a big fan of open-ended space combat / trading games (Privateer and Freelancer are my favorites). 3030 Deathwar does a lot of similar things that those games are known for. Talking to NPCs at bars in space stations and picking up missions, Mining asteroids and looting ships, purchasing new ships and upgrading them, or just exploring the galaxy.

However, unlike those games, it is played in top-down gameplay. I wasn’t sure about this at first but I’m having no issues with it. The graphics have a 90s retro feel to them...very similar to the classic Lucasarts and Sierra adventure games. The gameplay also has some point and click aspects of adventure games. You can walk into the bars and talk to NPCs and explore derelict space ships in your space suit and collect loot. The music is surprisingly well done and has a 80s and 90s vibe..it fits the game perfectly. Although, there is no voice acting which isn’t a big deal given the kind of game this is.

I’m very impressed with how much love the devs have put into this game..even the achievements are based on classic nostalgic movie quotes. I’m really enjoying this game hope they will continue to add more content in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970689911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1546303325}
review:
Wäre dies Spiel Anfang der 90er bei Lucas Arts erschienen, wäre es heute ein unvergessener Klassiker. Heutzutage ist es lediglich eine liebvoll gemachte Homage an die gute alte Zeit. Dabei weiß das Spiel mit seinem skurrilen Humor und diversen Anspielungen durchaus zu unterhalten.
Wer Spaß an Roger Wilco, Zac McKracken und den alten India Jones Adventures hatte, darf hier etwas genauer hinschauen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219751071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2335, 'last_played': 1702785435}
review:
Just got this game and have played it a bit. Haven't gotten too far in the story as of yet. Overall, it seems fun and the autosaves are fairly forgiving. My cheapo generic usb controller doesn't work with it. Always scrolls to the left for some reason. It works fine with emulators but I often have trouble with it for steam games. You don't need a controller though, and there are probably legit ones that work fine. It just depends on what you have.

My main gripe would be that the control scheme for the keyboard and mouse desperately needs an option for customization. There are a couple of modes to select from, but as of yet I hadn't figured out how to use the mouse ONLY for aiming. Right now both aiming and turning are linked which makes sense for the straight ahead shot, but makes the turret option not as useful as it could be.

If the developers added in complete control scheme customization, that would elevate this game from fairly good to very good or even great. Even so, that isn't a deal breaker and you can still have fun with this. The story/characters are fairly humorous and tongue in cheek rather than serious. That style is fine for me. As part of that, they also don't worry about being too PC or G rated, which is also good for me. That isn't to say that they get really graphic or something with raunchy stuff, they don't. But one example is one of the salvage things you can get is porno mags, but its not like you can browse through it (modders?). That element is for humor, not masturbation.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990604054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 824, 'last_played': 1701955978}
review: A great little game, brings back memories of similar stuff I played during my childhood.  Scratched an itch I'd had for a long time to play a trading/combat space game with a bit of story and a myriad of different ships to choose from.  My only real complaint is that I wish there were more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010366377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1545998587}
review:
This game plays a lot like Freelancer, you go from bar to bar picking up jobs and making either passenger, cargo, courier runs or bounty hunt pirates to earn cash and then buy bigger and better ships.  You can buy a wide variety of ships to suit your preferred style of play, want to haul large amounts of cargo, buy a freighter, want to go all Cray Taxi buy a speedy shuttle type ship.  On top of this you have the steam workshop to further modify the game.

P.S. The missions rewards are much more fair than those in Elite.
