author: {'steamid': '76561198020313592', 'num_games_owned': 986, 'num_reviews': 576, 'playtime_forever': 1062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1062, 'last_played': 1534693813}
review:
[h1] In A Nutshell [/h1]
3030 Deathwar Redux (DWR from now) is an open-wold sci-fi space opera title in which you will impersonate John Falcon, a spaceship salvage expert, and undertake over the top adventures featuring extravagant characters to help him get back to his former glory.

The center of all your activities will be the space station, there is at least one in each of the numerous systems on the map. Here, you can access a Trade Terminal, enabling you to trade goods you found, buy weapons and upgrades for your current ship, access the ship catalog to get a new ride, make repairs, and even buy amenities such as magazines you can actually read. Then you also have the Job Terminal, where all the available quests in that station are listed, divided in various types, such as assassination, transport, taxi, space garbage cleanup, container towing, and many more. Each space station also features a Lounge, where you can talk to unique NPCs, some there just to banter, while some others will become contacts and start secondary quests, or trade unique items.

Once left any station, the vastness of space will be open to you. DWR features a realtime map, where all systems and places are in the same chunk, without any loading times except to enter stations or space derelicts. Distances between things are often huge, that's why most ships are equipped with a warp drive that consumes more fuel when used, but is also essential in traveling between sectors. Dangers will be routine, as nebulas, space anomalies, stars and pirate ambushes will just be some of the dangers you will encounter while warp traveling. The interface to navigate all this and get an idea of where you need to go is decent enough, so you will unlikely get lost or stuck.

Aside from questing and jobs, there are also several careers you can engage, such as miner, trader, bounty hunter... there will be specific ships to better suit the needs of each career, but this doesn't mean a miner can't fight, or a bounty hunter can't mine. Player freedom is absolute in DWR. There are no skill trees or anything like that, only your ship, the equipment and your piloting skills will be what makes a difference. Of course, you can also become an outlaw pirate and kill everyone in sight if you wish to do so.

All of this sounds really awesome, and it is, in part, but what I really found DWR lacking about, is game pacing. The game and its contents themselves are not bad at all, but the general pace of quests, combat, dialogues, felt a bit too slow and clunky, and this partially limited enjoying what otherwise has been an all around solid title. 

[quote]Liked this review, and want to see more of the same quality? Check out [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/39323490]Tamaster's Review Archive[/url] to see all my Reviews in a single, convenient location.[/quote]

[h1] Gameplay Analysis [/h1]


[b] General Gameplay [/b]
Generally, the gameplay of DWR will be divided into Exploration, Dialogues and Combat. Exploration is performed on a persistent realtime galaxy map, is completely free roaming from the start, and features all sorts of unexpected discoveries and encounters around the various sectors. An interface around your ship will advise about what kind of objects are close to you, while the zoomable realtime map is useful for knowing what is where.

Dialogues with station NPCs are surprisingly varied, featuring a good amount of content, and many tales to listen to, some with even some useful information in them. There are no RPG-like choices or checks to pass, as NPCs will simply tell you what you ask them, without any specific requirement in most cases, unless quest related. 

DWR also features a minigame of sorts: when boarding a derelict ship the game becomes a side-scrolling shooter, and you will control our fellow adventurer, wrecking abandoned ships apart to loot what may be left inside.

Overall I found the gameplay of DWR to be pleasant as many other space-opera games, the only disappointment being the pacing of it, which was a bit too clunky and slow.

[b] Story [/b]
The story will not be very elaborate, but not minimal either. There is a decent amount of content to it, and characters you encounter have good personalities and realization. Side quests and just station banter add a lot to the lore content of the game.


[b] Combat System [/b]
Combat is simple enough, but hard to master. WASD to move your ship around, and space to fire: dodging bullets while also hitting the enemy is paramount, while also dealing with inertia, ship module damage, and eventual missiles or enemy turrets. Personally, I found the control system for combat to be not very good, as it is very hard to hit enemies, while foes, being computer controlled, have a marked advantage in accuracy. This said, combat is certainly passable, but not the best.


[b] Content & Pricing [/b]
Depending on your play-style, money farming methods, and just how much you want to explore, this game can last between 12-15 to 20-25 hours. For a base price of 14.99€, i'd say it's worth the money if you are a fan of sci-fi adventures and space opera games, while for everyone else, you can aswell wait for a sale.


[b] Balancing & Challenge [/b]
Some weapons and ships are quite unbalanced, a shining example being the Ion Cannon, the most ridiculous weapon in the game, delivering insane damage at a relatively affordable price. Combine it with an auto-aim turret, and you have the perfect recipe for death. Overall the balance is not bad at all, delivering challenge and engagement steadily enough. Challenge rating is Medium.



[h1] Technical Analysis [/h1]


[b] Graphics [/b]
Well done pixel art, purposefully low-res graphics, give out a unique style exuding originality from every pore. Good effects, and a lot of little details that summed up, make a big positive difference in quality.


[b] Sound [/b]
Exceptional soundtrack, with some of the tracks sticking in your head for days on end. Decent sound effects.


[b] Performance & Stability [/b]
Nothing to report.


[b] AI [/b]
Enemy AI will use attack patterns relative to their equipment and ship type, expect different styles of enemies as you progress.


[b] Quality of Life [/b]
Interface and menus do the job alright, without any major issue. 


[b] Bugs / Issues [/b]
Nothing major to report, the game is polished good and proper after many updates.



[h1] Conclusion & Rating [/h1]
Deathwar Redux is definitely an original space-opera adventure that will be the joy of any fan of this type of game, and also for anyone looking for an adventure different from the regular ones you are used to. While far from being perfect, its charming style and varied situations made me develop a strange love-hate relationship with this game, one that in the end, didn't leave any bitter taste.

[h1] RATING: 7.5 / 10 [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198002922277', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 869, 'last_played': 1665119105}
review:
TL;DR: Extremely unique, beautiful game that I am obsessed with and cannot recommend enough. Seriously. 

I do not often leave reviews, especially positive ones, but this game absolutely deserves it. I have a sort of never ending lust for quality space RPG's where the player is more than a ship and a player portrait. Finding a quality space RPG where one can get out of the ship and stretch your legs is very cool. It is especially rare to find a space game where the universe and general atmosphere feel strange. Every game just feels "futuristic", but we have all seen dozens of games and movies that take place in the future. There's no sense of adventure in those games for me, but this game really gives you a sense of being a bit of an alien yourself. It's strange and unfamiliar. You've got to figure it out. 

The artwork and music are absolutely wonderful. Soundtrack especially is a true joy and for once in my life, I have been able to mine asteroids in a space RPG! The music and general feeling keep me entertained well enough to, when I want to eat some food and play this beautiful game, I can just do some mining and relax. No other game has ever been able to get me to go near a mining laser.

Story so far is pretty interesting and I am enjoying it. I am also greatly enjoying the side quests, especially the bounty hunter ones, though I do wish that they were more plentiful. Still, hunting pirates down in their "last seen" sector is fun, too. While the combat isn't the greatest, I don't find it particularly lacking and I am content with it. 

The station designs inside and outside are almost all excellent, creative and awe inspiring. This game is almost like Morrowind in space. It gives me that sense of mystery and adventure that no game really has since Morrowind. For me, that is something almost sacred. 

I cannot recommend this game enough and I wish nothing but great things for those that have worked on it. If any of my friends express interest but don't want to pay the more than fair purchase price, I will totally buy it for them. I just fucking love this game so, so much. I've only been able to play 3 times since purchasing it but I already have 11 hours. Each time I sat down and didn't stop until I had to go to bed. If I could have, I would have put 11 hours in the first night, no problem. This game is addicting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058302073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1534250302}
review:
I've currently put on 8 hours to this little gem in just three days, and needless to say I'm definetly going to put a lot more in the future. This game for me turned out to be the perfect"visualizer", if you will , to my love for a futuristic themed video game . 
Music wise, one of my most niche favorite genres was ambient vaporwave. When it came to movies I was a huge nerd for Robocop, Blade Runner and District 9 and in TV I fell in love with Futurama. These shows and movies planted the seeds to my head on what I believed the future would like, which helped me create my own unique fantasy world. This games music as well as the gameplay helped grow this world of mine and expanded it with it's beautyfull charatchers. 

Also thank you Devs for still giving us updates and expaning the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198318435145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 772, 'last_played': 1533746168}
review:
这款游戏，应该是小成本游戏（我猜的，别喷我）
但是有着非常完善的细节以及有趣的设定
不胜枚举，以至于我通关之后再去仔细观察还有不少惊喜
并且音乐非常之棒

游戏性方面很丰富，有赏金，有任务，主线，挖坟（横面射击）

甚至可以用飞船去参与一个追逐比赛

但是，正因为他是一个小游戏，这些内容都不多，很快就会感到重复，这点十分遗憾。

关于没有中文
这个嘛，其实没有也能摸索出来，主线剧情也不是很难，你知道几个英文单词就可以去猜着玩，当然最好要有过啃生肉的经历，不然啃起来确实咬不动这个游戏。

再说一遍，首尾呼应，这个游戏细节真的是太多的，简直细节控，完全不像是这样一个游戏会有的细腻度，而且音乐非常赞，游戏文件夹有原声，大家可以来试试这款游戏。

第一次写评测，有感而发，因为真的是喜欢这个游戏的细节，还有音乐。有所不足，多多包涵。

author: {'steamid': '76561197972276575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1533480851}
review:
Basically it's a Frontier / Elite clone in 2D, with some walking around and talking to people thrown in, and a story to drive you to visit new locations.

This means the usual trading, mining, and selection of fetch-quest, taxi, or combat missions from a mission screen.

If you like that sort of thing, great, otherwise it suffers the same replayability problems that all games like this have - there's simply not a lot to do once you've seen every mission type it has to offer. 

Also travelling between systems can be boring as you just wait a long time without anything happening counting down the ligh years until your destination. This reminds me too much of a long car journey counting down the miles on the navigation system. Some sort of fast travel system would have been helpful here.

I'll update the review if things change as I get further into the game, but so far it's not looking very likely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124354461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1817, 'last_played': 1558818686}

review: Great game. Period. Had a few bugs before with the controller but after the update I've had no problems. So far the game has been great. Music is perfect for the genre/game and the story is absolutely great. Compared to other games it may not have the fancy graphics and all but the graphics it does have look amazing, work well, and add a lot of spunk to the game itself. The gameplay is fun, quite fullfilling even, and its the type of complete all-around space adventure I would like to see in other games. Really recommend it!! You'll have tons of fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970926231', 'num_games_owned': 1880, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1693, 'last_played': 1523291633}
review:
This is an excellent game, and an absolute steal at their full asking price of 15$. The game feels cohesive and no matter which of the space sim tasks you take you feel like you are doing something worthwhile, whether that is trading, mining, salvaging, delivering, or pirate hunting. The combat is simple yet satisfying. If you rush through to the end, could be a very short game, however it is difficult not to go off on a tangent on the way.

Very happy to see the dev support on this game, seems to be some real love there. They are actively improving the game while also embracing the modding community. I've only seen mods for ships and weapons, however the devs talk about opening that up to quests and missions. I look forward to seeing where this game goes, definitely a game I will be returning to.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966798489', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1634247189}
review:
I can't tell you how awesome this game is, you just have to experience it yourself.  

From the rich atmosphere of the game, to the old school top down combat (which I was never a fan of until this game) it brings you in.  The economy and trade system is thought out and you can make money but just doing that.  You don't have to follow the story line but obviously you will because it grabs you and makes you want to figure out why things are the way they are.

Buy this, enjoy it, play it, love it.  A fucking awesome game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962135992', 'num_games_owned': 991, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1331, 'last_played': 1530598293}
review:
3030 Deathwar Redux is a great 10-20 hours of exciting space exploration and combat. I played it hoping for Escape Velocity, but I got something slightly different. It's good through the whole progression, even if the game is shorter than I was hoping.

Pros:
+The game has a great feel to the space movement very similar to EV games, where velocity in a single direction continues, even if you turn your ship.
+Space exploration is amazing. Traveling between galaxies is thrilling at times, and always at least makes you think.
+Simple controls and mechanics, that still leave a lot of room for learning how to better play the game. I felt like I was learning how to fly, traverse, fight better every hour or so as I learned something new.
+I do like the ship variation as how they affect gameplay and what you're able to do.
+The missions are actually pretty fun, even though they're repetetive. I found myself taking 3-4 missions at a time and balancing taxi missions, delivering missions, scouting missions and pickup missions to try to maximize profits, before switching to mining and pirate hunting. I have never done that in a game (each money making source) as usually one of them isn't as good, but really, you can do whatever you want. Mining is restrictive early though, because of cargo space.
+The game has mods, though there aren't really any right now. Hopefully someone finds a way to make a story mod, or throw in some factions, or anything to spice up the universe. This is a future hopeful Pro.
+Although simple, getting out of your ship and entering space stations, or looting derelicts or landing on planets (story only) is a nice change of pace from EV's HUD/text only space stations.
+Through the 20 hours I put in, I never felt bored, and always had a story mission or money to make for the next ship or the next upgrade. I enjoyed the money making as much as the rest, so it felt like time well spent.
+The game supports crazy wide screens like my 3440x1440 resolution with no problem. It looks really nice. It plays smooth and space never looked more exciting.

Cons:
-The game does not have the replayability of the EV games. It reminds me more of Rebel Galaxy, in that you have a few options outside of the story like trading, mining, pirating, etc, but no real reason to do it outside of monetary gains, of which there's little point.
-The ship customization system is basic. You buy upgrades, of which there is no weight limits, and no difference between ships except for turret/gun placement and missile number. Everything else you just buy the best and you are done.
-The combat is too easy. Once you get a ship with a turret, it's game over if you keep your ECM finger ready and boost whenever you're about to get in someone's fire. I went without taking even a hit to my shields dozens of times against many foes.
-Ships, even though varied and feel different, follow a progression path that is too simplistic. There isn't a reason to have a good fighter or a massive cargo ship. Once you get the fast/300 ton cargo/turret/14missile ship, there's no reason to change. More missiles aren't that helpful, few ships are faster, but sacrifice a ton of cargo or the turret (that's a no go). I saved for the best ships but they weren't as good as that ship. I didn't find a "favorite" ship as much as I just found the  one that did everything. There was never a time when I felt like "Oh I love this ship" and I will use it even when I shouldn't. I just moved up constantly.
-Locations are generic most of the time and there doesn't feel like there's a difference between anywhere. Every single place is super multiracial, so there's no stations specifically for aliens, or humans, so everything seems randomized. There's no factions that are noticeable, beyond "Colonial". 

Overall: I definitely enjoyed the game, and unfairly compare it to EV games. While it is similar and plays much like it, the EV games are much grander in scope, customization and story, while this sacrifices that for much, much better space flight and exploration. I've never played a game where flying through space, literally nothing, was exciting. Somehow this game makes it so much fun, I would fill my 300 cargo space with fuel and travel the galaxy non-stop looking for edges of nebula to map the galaxy and looking for secrets (there are some... shhh).

Please try this game if you like the genre. It's worth it. If the game ever gets expanded, or intriguing mods, I will be back for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015036952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2928, 'last_played': 1530515765}
review:
This game has all the makings of a great space RPG/action adventure. All the elements are there and they are executed pretty much really well throughout the game. I think my favorite aspect of the game is the space travel and ability to customize/upgrade your ship over the course of the story. I enjoyed the fact that there is an over-arcing story to begin with that unfolds as you go. And I liked the flow and the general feeling I got from playing - that I was pulled in and part of what happened and that made me care. My definitiion of a good game is one that makes me care, at least to some degree.

Cons of the game were that I ran into some glitches occasionally, particularly with the derelict searches, but nothing that stopped me from enjoying the game. Another challenge is not being able to save while on missions and there are a few points where that could require being extra careful. Again, not a show stopper.

My bottom line is that if this type of game is your cup of tea, then take a sip. In fact, drink deep and gulp it down. It will quench your thirst more than adequately. I still have the final mission to finish in the game but I definitely recommend it - at least give it a try. 

I look forward to other projects by these folks and hope they move ever onward and upward with their quality.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963623824', 'num_games_owned': 723, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1531125540}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002438927', 'num_games_owned': 514, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1530580712}
review:
I just discovered the game via Steam Summer Sale and put 5 hours into it right away! Fun story with great humor, AWESOME soundtrack, fun mechanics and characters, all around a blast to play! They are not getting the coverage they deserve on this game.

-If you've played FTL and wished you could explore the galaxy in an open world setting, this game is for you.
-If you love pixelated space games (like Starbound and Halycon 6) , this is for you
-If you love trading / mining / exploring / ship upgrades, this game is for you
-If you love the show Firefly, this game is for you
-If you've wanted to be Han Solo, this game is for you

I also really appreicate that the game introduces new mechanics and technologies as you play and you aren't given everything all at once. It makes for some interesting gameplay and gives you a real sense of progression.

I recommend you check out Biscuit Dog's game review called "3030 Deathwar Redux: I Love This Game!"


For 50% off, it's a steal.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970613310', 'num_games_owned': 1125, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2569, 'last_played': 1530162807}
review:
I decided to pick this game up because it looked a bit silly, and I'm a sucker for space adventure games with a story.

I am so glad I did. The game has a few similarities to another game I played way back in the late 90s or so, which I very much enjoyed. It was simple, but lots of fun. This game turned out to be much the same as far as fun factor, but with added bonuses of landing on stations and mining, neither of which were in the game so many years ago. The story is engaging, and has some spots that really had me chuckling at the cut-scenes. Humor is a big bonus, in my opinion!

The ship selection is outstanding, with so many different builds for different playstyles. Also there's a very gradual curve as far as prices, so you can keep upgrading quite regularly, without grinding for long periods of time to make a bunch of cash. Trade-in value is very generous, so you don't lose a lot when upgrading to different ships.

I very much recommend this game if you're looking for a fun little space adventure with lots of exploring, potential for mining or running missions for cash, and good humor value.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993347656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 942, 'last_played': 1530152520}

author: {'steamid': '76561197990058153', 'num_games_owned': 625, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1530156912}
review:
There is an endearing simplicity to "3030 Deathwar Redux - A Space Odyssey". 

At its core, it is a top-down arcade space shooter where you complete missions to gain money and upgrade your ships. The combat is serviceable, but thankfully the game doesn't force you into a fighting role to advance the story. In fact, most of the missions are either delivery or taxi contracts, It is also quite possible to make money by mining asteroids, or salvaging lost ships. However, salvaging is a strange "platforming" mini-game which I found less enjoyable than the other activities.

The space travel and exploration between system is honestly quite clever, although it is also confusing at the beginning when you don't know how to use the star map. For example, nebulas are hazards that any new player will want to avoid at all cost, but a well-equipped ship can technically power through them (albeit slowly).  Since some contracts are on a timer, finding shortcuts in nebulas between two systems can be incredibly satisfying. Furthermore, fuel management will force you to think of optimal flight plans around the map.

Most of the time, you will find yourself travelling between space stations in different systems. While there are activities to do along the way, what makes this experience truly enjoyable is the superb choice of music for the soundtrack. It is a perfect fit that enhances the ambience significantly.  

The adventure part of the game is found mainly in discussions with the characters you find in space stations around the universe. The main story and characters are all a bit silly, but in a good way. The game is filled with subtle, and not so subtle, references to science fiction and pop culture. More importantly, the characters found in stations make the universe feel alive in a way very few games manage to do. That, in itself, may be the greatest achievement of this game. It also helps that Falcon and its detective robot are funny/adorable characters. 

In a strange way, the graphics style of Deathwar reminds me of Grand Theft Auto 2. Indeed, the game would not look out of place in 1998. This older style of graphics creates a nostalgic feeling which is well-suited to this genre of game. With that said, the UI can be incredibly clunky (e.g., all the wasted space in station consoles) and the low resolution will certainly be a deterrent to some players. 

It is clear that "3030 Deathwar Redux - A Space Odyssey" is a labour of love by a tiny, dedicated development team. The game may be sharp around the edges, and a bit slow at the beginning, but it is quite enjoyable once you get the hang of it. It is a bit expensive for what it is though, so I would suggest to buy it on sale. 

Overall, I recommend it to anyone willing to experience a surprisingly ambitious little arcade space shooter, sprinkled with a healthy dose of humour and an over-the-top story set in a strangely believable universe. 

Most importantly, I enjoyed my time with "3030 Deathwar Redux - A Space Odyssey"!

author: {'steamid': '76561197983225082', 'num_games_owned': 864, 'num_reviews': 321, 'playtime_forever': 1540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1514, 'last_played': 1531279720}
review:
I really like this game. That being said some of the graphics just drive me up a wall! Once you enter a space station its a little tiny screen that only covers about 30% of the screen the rest of the stuff is just random flashing artwork. Ugh. The weird and slightly strange menu system is also a bit of a pain. Its not very streamlined at all. So those are two very annoying points in this game. You have to read all of the dialogue and its very funny stuff. So I do enjoy that part of the game. Its just those really ugly menus. I wish they were bigger because again they only take up about 30% of the screen. 

Outside in space is wonderful. Its bright, it takes up the full screen, its easy to navigate. Its fun. Navigation is easy enough if a bit cumbersome. I really wish the game would direct your actions a little bit more or give out helpful hints on where to go. I have to hit the map menu a lot more then I should have to. The inside of the space station feels like it was ripped from a game where 640*800 was common place. That being said I have enjoyed playing the game. Its easy to get around and to play in space.

UPDATE: I just finished this game. It was a fun ride. The game does continue even if you do finish it. I dont finish many games so this game held my interest all the way to the very end. Great job developers.
developer_response:
Hi baddog993, I'm glad you enjoy the game. I just wanted to reply and say that you're right, the game was made 10+ years ago when widescreen just wasn't around. Everything was developed and hand positioned for a 1024x768 resolution... which is why you see the black bar space on space stations.

To be honest they drive me up the wall, too!! 

Thanks for taking the time to leave a review, really glad you're enjoying the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072385593', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1666005243}

author: {'steamid': '76561198016663970', 'num_games_owned': 807, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1592759549}
review:
Hidden gem game.
Very enjoyable and makes a good effort at bringing 'adventure' back to space sim gaming.
It has the expected space combat and options to do trade, bounties, pirating, mining, deliveries, complete with a mission board.
But it also has space stations that feel more alive.
One of my favorite things about the game so far is that when you do a delivery mission, you will have to actually go up to the person at the station to finalize the delivery. Who would've thought that this minor detail made so much difference. It really makes you feel more immersed in the game than just a notification popping up saying 'thanks for the delivery'.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981588360', 'num_games_owned': 880, 'num_reviews': 401, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1527811140}
review: I feel really bad giving a thumbs down to this game.  It's obviously a passion project, but there is really isn't much of a game loop outside what is available in the first 3 minutes.  You can visit dozens of solar systems and even more space stations, but they're all nearly identical with little to nothing to do at each.
developer_response:
Hi 40GallonTophat,

thanks for your feedback. You are correct about the lack of variety in station layouts but the mechanic is intentionally simple with new mission types getting unlocked with story progression and experience, as well as new ships and upgrades allowing new activities like hunting pirates and taking part in space races.

With continued community support we are adding more content and have recently added modding that can help address this as well. Currently we are not getting much exposure so reviews are very valuable for us to help promote the game, hopefully if more content is added it will tip the balance of your review to positive. Thanks again for your feedback, please let us know any more details or what should be our top priorities to improve in our Feature Requests forums.

Cheers,
Max, Matt and Mike

author: {'steamid': '76561198002073999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1529470756}
review:
Buy this game right now!

"3030 Deathwar Redux - A Space Odyssey" strongly resembles a freeware game released in the 90's by Ambrosia Software: "Escape Velocity."  This new title builds on Ambrosia's concept with a passion, expanding gameplay while adding lots of modern production value.

The soundtrack is phenomenal, every track an earworm.  Best music in a game since Hotline Miami.  Perfectly composed and tailor made for an interstellar-faring game.

The writing is literate and clever, without trying to take over the experience.  Dialogue and narration are easy skim for game objectives and click through, but also quite creative and thoughtful at times.  As a technical writer, I'm pleased to see such masterful execution.  Like the music, this element of the game takes a passenger seat, to better help you navigate the real experience, which is...

...casting around the universe's milky nebulae.  Running out of fuel between solar systems and making it to the next station running on fumes.  Ending up on the wrong side of the celestial tracks, and slinking away from predatory pirate ships.  All these great experiences of the imagination I got to have as a kid, done up for a new generation.

Props to the makers of this game, and thanks for practicing your craft so masterfully!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035393296', 'num_games_owned': 1156, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1743, 'last_played': 1528405262}
review: I bought this game on sale a while back and just got around to playing it and completing the main campaign. Overall, 3030 Death War Redux is a highly entertaining space sim/adventure game. None of the content in this game is necessarily outstanding on it's own exactly, but the whole is clearly greater then the sum of it's parts. It's less then 20 dollars US on steam right now, so you really should at least give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984737098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 827, 'last_played': 1528465976}
review:
This game surprised me. Very good for an indie game and well worth the pricetag, but if its on sale you shoud deffinetly get it. The game is charming and immensly atmospheric. If you like games such as Freelancer and similar space games you'll enjoy this. The game is very "on the nose" and not very serious which was fun. The soundtrack is unique and might not hit it off with everyone but its very configurable and you can turn off vocal tracks if you like, but personally I liked it a lot. I was dissapointed that trading and mining is useless however. No reason to get a cargo ship really since missions pay much more than even a perfect trade of full cargo for cheap and selling high. The game is not combat based (at least as far as I have gotten), but it does have combat and its pretty good and intense if you partake in it. Basically to summarize the game, its a top down space game in the vein of Freelancer. The game doesnt have a HUGE amount of depth to it, but its good. Atmosphere might remind you of Cowboy Bebop and especially Space Dandy (I even saw a commercial ship with a Space Dandy commercial on it)

Pros:
- interesting Lucas Arts adventure style graphics in stations
- unique soundtrack (some might not like it but you can configure it)
- fun combat
- cool ships (what else do you need?)
- lots of star systems for an indie game
- atmospheric
- Rich Evans is in it as an NPC

Cons:
- trading and mining is useless (this is such a common problem for these games that its not even surprising anymore)
- not very deep
- story is hard to follow and sometimes nonsensical
- salvaging minigame is a cool addition but ultimately useless and unrewarding
- main character looks like he reviews video games on steam in his spare time

Overall, get this game if you like these types of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025435479', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1477, 'last_played': 1527593201}
review:
Naprawdę fajna i wciągająca gra, dwuwymiarowy space sim, w którym wcielamy się w pilota statku, który zostaje wplątany w pewną intrygę. 
Podróżując po mapie składającej się z kilkudziesięciu układów, w większości których znajduje się przynajmniej jedna stacja kosmiczna, mamy do dyspozycji różne drogi kariery. Od kuriera dostarczającego paczki przez przeszukiwanie wraków statków za wartościowymi rzeczami, górnika wydobywającego surowce z asteroid po pirata atakującego statki by przejąć ich ładunek lub łowcę głów ścigającego piratów, a to i tak nie wszystko. Dzięki zarobionym kredytom możemy kupować coraz lepsze statki (a jest ich naprawdę sporo), wyposażenie do nich i broń.
Na pewno mocną stroną jest klimat gry, te wszystkie drobne ale jednak ważne detale dobrze współgrające z pikselartową grafiką i świetnie pasującą do tego oprawą muzyczną.
Podczas gry nie trafiłem na żadne błędy, gra wydaje się bardzo dobrze dopracowana i przemyślana.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025385712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1669590992}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995102952', 'num_games_owned': 817, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1555842903}
review:
3030 Deathwar Redux is a good game with a potential to be a great one in its niche. Gamers who fondly remember Elite, Frontier, Privateer and others of this kind will find the game a pleasant experience. With recently (?) enabled modding support this game could be so much more.

I look forward to new content both by the developers and modders.

Also big thanks for introducing me to the music of The Kyoto Connection.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982748375', 'num_games_owned': 808, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1527405756}
review:
One liner: What a charming little gem this turned out to be.

Pros:
Great soundtrack. Really loved the jams while flying around. Did not expect that at all.
Do you like Privateer as much as I do?  You'll love the open world/open mission concepts at play here.  Do taxi runs, courier packages, or kick back and relax with some mining.  Kit out a fighter ship and go bounty hunting.  Track down hulking shipwrecks and loot them for profit.  Piracy is an option.  Lots of ways to make money and it encourages exploration while also catering to many play styles.
Related to play styles, there's tons of ships and so you can easily go from a missile-toting fighter, to a commercial passenger ship, to huge transport ship with upgrade paths to support all styles.
Big galaxy to explore.
I dig the 16-bit era Lucasarts aesthetic they went for.  It's a bit more modern in the flight segments.

Cons:
I wish there was a bit more meat on the "adventure game" portions of the game.  Mostly all you do is visit the trade and job terminals with the occasional dialogue tree for Plot Important NPCs.  Would've been nice to see some unique puzzles i.e. the one during the last mission which I won't spoil here.
While the galaxy is big it can get a bit same-y over time.
Can't save while you have active missions but are penalized a little bit for ditching them.
Thats about it - I really don't have any huge complaints.

Misc:
I completed the main story after 13 hours according to Steam - though it's really more like 10.  Because of the mentioned inability to save during missions I actually left the game running for a few hours while I went to the movies.  There is postgame as you might expect, leaving the galaxy available for exploration and continued jobs if you feel like it.
I would love to see a sequel some day.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986511199', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1527403056}

Overall an entertaining game if you are into space games in general.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970527998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1552, 'last_played': 1534082714}

author: {'steamid': '76561198268168515', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 611, 'last_played': 1527361180}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198028572092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 10415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9972, 'last_played': 1685597001}
review: Wow.  So much to say.  If you love space sims, a good adventure story, killing pirates/mining/trading to upgrade ships, or you played those old school adventure games, you're in for nostalgia city.  Love all the little attention to details.  I really hope a mod community develops around this game, because this is one of those games you wish there were more of when you beat it.  If you played Privateer or Freelancer, you'll know what I'm talking about.  Whether on sale or full price, this one is well worth it.

review:
I love the feeling of this game, the art, the visual effect, music are all perfect, but it is a little tiring to play without Chinese.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076245110', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1821, 'last_played': 1560448670}
review:
LOVE this game!! I've only put around 26 hours into this game so far but enjoying it very much. You can tell a lot of effort has go into this. Amazing soundtrack too, who knew 80's music would sound chuffing awesome while flying around! anyway, I highly recommend you check out this game. If you're a fan of elite dangerous but in a pixel, top down, 2D side scrolling sci-fi action game, you'll do just fine! 

And for the devs, top job, keep up the excellent work!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028423570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 939, 'last_played': 1532742014}
review:
The space adventure game is in a weird state of limbo right now. AAA developers have been trying to make the next big hit for the past several years, yet none have been successful. No Man's Sky, overhyped and overestimated, managed to be the greatest disappointment of this gaming generation. Elite: Dangerous, the successor to the legendary game that created the genre, ended up vast and empty, just like space itself. Star Citizen, the most expensive crowdfunded project of all time, is still in development, years past its original deadline with no end in sight. These games have cast a shadow of doubt over the viability of the open-world space genre, and all of these cases seem to be proof to the growing fear that it might just be impossible to make space [i]interesting[/i] in video games.

If you agreed with any of the above, you need to get [i]3030 Deathwar Redux[/i] right now. What makes [i]3030 Deathwar Redux[/i] truly special is the vibrancy of its open-world: instead of drifting through empty, cold space, you’ll constantly be meeting weird, funny characters in the bars of space stations. Travelling through space will never feel empty when you’re jamming out to retro 80’s synthpop. The plot is nothing particularly incredible or surprising, but the writing is top-notch; with humor taking inspiration from cheesy LucasArts adventure games like Monkey Island. The genius of this game is simply in its charm: the story, characters, and world come together in an amazing package that makes space seem [i]fun[/i].

If you're burnt out on open-world space games, please give this one a shot. It will rejuvenate your love for the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047126664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1527142108}
review:
This game is very goofy, and at one point, Crow T Robot is a bartender, so basically 11/10

Also you can kinda just... Go.  Forever.  In space.  Fight some damn pirates, break the space economy, buy new space cars.  It's rad as hell and the amount of gameplay you can (presumably) get, for the price, is well worth it.

Can't reccomend this enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003030375', 'num_games_owned': 3129, 'num_reviews': 773, 'playtime_forever': 710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 710, 'last_played': 1525853255}
review:
3030 Deathwar Redux – A Space Odyssey:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 
How hard is it to spread your wings as a successful scavenger in 3030? From where I am sitting, it seems to be quite challenging. Take a look at this fellow who goes by the name of John Falcon. An astute operator who travels the galaxy in search of abandoned spaceships and their cargo. Let me tell you, John is one of the best in the business of retrieving goods from derelicts. With a healthy intergalactic bank account of two million credits, he came across the best deal in the galaxy . . . a stunning vessel with great firepower, speed, and the ability to hold a huge cargo, all for only two million credits (a third of its value)!  After this unbelievable purchase, John kept moving from one derelict to another until his cargo hold was full. Upon docking at the nearest station to refuel his vessel and sell its cargo, he was told by an officer that the deal of the galaxy was, in fact, a stolen ship and has to be impounded. Here you go John, take these 1500 credits, a crappy two seater vessel and this package to be delivered to the next solar system! Welcome to 3030 Dearthwar Redux – A Space Odyssey!   

3030 Deathwear Redux – A Space Odyssey is a sci-fi action /adventure game where you take control of John Falcon, who sold a stolen ship and has to restart his wealth from scratch. The question is, which way will he choose to get there?

At the station where his new vessel was seized, John will become aware of the disappearance of a large ship named the Largo, which was carrying an extremely valuable cargo. He will also learn of the restriction imposed upon all scavengers by a local pirate lord, to not attempt to retrieve the Largo’s cargo, or face certain death! 

It’s a bit much for John to absorb all of this at once, but nonetheless he wants to get back on his feet as soon as possible. At each of the stations, he will be able to pick up work through the job station (delivering parcels, taking down pirates, taking pictures of an unknown planet and others). All of these jobs will earn him credits if he successfully completes them. Bear in mind that some of these jobs will have a time limit attached to them and the countdown will start as soon as he accepts them. The other point is that you can only have four active jobs at any given time. By using the trade console, John will be able to buy or sell goods (prices of goods vary in each station), buy new ships if he has enough dough, upgrade or repair his vessel, and also refuelling it. Or he can just head up to the bar and chat with other characters! 

When he is done at the station, he’ll be able to explore the current solar system, or he’ll be on his way to complete a job. Every time he discovers a solar system, John will be able to open the system map and identify the position of the stations, as well as the location of abandoned ships. The derelict will be represented by a purple dot before he goes through it, and will turn green after visiting it. The moving green dots are friendly vessels (freighters, traders etc.) and the red ones are pirates. Most of his first jobs will be within the first solar system, but soon after they will spread into unknown systems. Not to worry, a green arrow will show him where to go within the galaxy map.  Beware of the nebulas and its storms, which can heavily damage his vessel when passing through them. He can become aware of the storms within nebulas if he discovers discs containing storm data, which are usually found on derelicts.

As soon as John’s vessel hovers over an abandoned vessel, he will automatically be in his space suit and start to explore the ship. With the help of a scanner, John will be able to locate possible survivors (receiving a big reward), R.I.P members (receiving a small reward), valuable goods (adding credit to your bank account), junk (waste of space) and crates (good to sell at stations). He will encounter some strange alien lifeforms but they are really easy to kill. 

Pirates are another kettle of fish; John needs to defeat small pirates first in order to get a shot at the big ones. He’ll need a ship with a large arsenal to increase his chance of winning these fights.

Great Pixel art accompanied by a superb soundtrack. In terms of controls, you can either use the keyboard and mouse, keyboard only or play with your gamepad. This game has plenty of content and offers plenty of re-playability. The only things that took me a bit of time to get use to is the interface, and it can be repetitive too. Apart from that, it’s a pretty cool game!

Positives:
~~~~~~~ 

+	Good Pixel artwork
+	30 Solar systems to discover
+	Stacks of jobs to do
+	Fabulous soundtrack
+	Fun characters and story
+	Achievements

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~ 

-	A bit repetitive
-	No trading cards as yet

Looking for the final frontier adventure? 3030 Deathwar Redux - A Space Odyssey would be that one! 

8/10

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065046595', 'num_games_owned': 611, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1525401576}
review: I relize that they are a really small team, but they should not lable full controller support. Especially If they have only tested an Xbox controller and people are having so many problems using controllers in the forums, with no fix!
developer_response:
Hey Landis,

we're sorry you are disappointed. It clearly says in our system requirements that only XBox-type controllers are supported, but it's understandable that can easily be missed.

Just so you know, Steam has a clear guideline on when a game must be marked as 'Full Controller Support': "Must work entirely with an Xbox or similar controller from installation to play and beyond."

In closing, the game plays very well with Keyboard and Mouse as well. We hope you give the game another shot :)

Best Regards,
-Max and the 3030 Team

author: {'steamid': '76561198073346678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1043, 'last_played': 1561755341}
review:
This game is so much fun.

I'd say its a bit like Monkey Island and subspace and sid meirs pirates. I haven't got to far into the story as I've been exploring the galaxy as a bus driver delivering messages and ferrying people to weddings to earn credits to buy a better ship. Haven't even tried to attempt a bounty hunt yet as my poor bus would probabbbly get shot to pieces.

Also this is the first game I've ever tried modding and thanks to the easy to follow tutorial I managed to create a couple of new ships for the game.

Worth the money and the devs are really quick to respond to any issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120582514', 'num_games_owned': 974, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1524789260}
review: I just finished the story line for this game and i just wanna say wow! this game is great, sure it isn't triple a developer and may have a little kink here and there but its an indie developer and that just makes it all the more amazing for what they delivered here if you ask me. This game looks wonderful and is an absolute blast to play, there's something about warping through space or blowing up pirates to this game's soundtrack that just works. One of the best things about this game is even when you finish the main story the game isn't one of the ones that's just like well thats it nothing left to do, you can continue to just zoom around through space blasting pirates, scavenging direlects, and running jobs, all while racking up credits to buy bigger and badder ships and upgrades. I don't have many hours on this game at the time i'm writing this but it has me hooked and i'm going to continue to play it more and more until i've done just about everything i can do. 10/10 would recommend for anyone who likes open world space games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012512972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1523778116}
review:
This game has scratch an itch that has followed me for decades of gaming. It has trade wars elements, space quest, ship upgrades, missions and much more. The game is simplictic it what it offers but does them all so well. 

Two things need to happen, 3030 Deathwar Redux II  eeds to be releaseed adding crew management/space exploration and on world missions with fighting.

A huge million dollar+ investment needs to be pushed to hire a larege staff and make III tripple a, keep its 2d views but polishing the hell outa the game with voiced dialog etc.

To the makers of this game, thank you! You nailed what ever this is perfectly and I love it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004865494', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1514415889}
review:
This game is fun as sheeeeit. I love the art style, the controls are tight and the writing is comical.

The only real disappointment is that the music appears to be stock music from the Kevin MacLeod library, though the tunes from the Kyoto Connection are quite nice. Can't blame the devs too much as producing original music is quite a lot of work and they're a very small team.

Overall, great game. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096608094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1523010849}
review: I played all the way through, but it's only a sort of alright game, not a particularly good one. Space combat is so rapidfire and flashy that it's almost impossible to follow what's going on. So you'll probably spend the first half of the game avoiding it entirely, and then the latter half of the game (once you've received a decent ship) blasting enemies to smithereens, when the occasion warrants it. The game tries to offset this rather shallow space sim gameplay with some adventure-esque elements, but while they (sometimes) visually compare to old LucasArts adventure games, the writing and "puzzles" (what few there are) aren't up to par, and the ending is a serious letdown. There were also some bugs that didn't prevent me from finishing my own playthrough but would be game-breaking for a completionist. I'd get it for cheap (like 3-5 dollars) because it was engaging enough, but I wouldn't get it for full price.
developer_response:
Hi skathe,

thanks for your feedback. You're right that combat is initially difficult, as pirates are well equipped and you don't have the upgrades necessary to be a super effective fighter at the beginning of the game. Our goal was to give players a feeling of progress, so that you would initially have some trouble fighting one or two enemies, but would be able to take on a full squadron later. This approach probably isn't optimal for everyone, but we prefer this design to a "scaling" system where enemies become stronger as you do.

We also understand that combat might feel a bit shallow by itself, so we tried to add other space activities, such as asteroid mining, space races, crew rescue and refueling your ship from a star's corona. With continued community support, we plan on adding even more activities and to expand the 3030 universe. Currently we are not getting much exposure so reviews are very valuable for us to help promote the game, hopefully if more content is added it will tip the balance of your review to positive. Thanks again for your feedback, and please let us know any more thoughts or what you think we could do to improve the game in our Feature Requests forums.

Cheers,
Max, Matt and Mike

author: {'steamid': '76561198127053853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 910, 'last_played': 1599074484}
review: Hoo boy... This is a game I really had a blast to sit down and play. It was a geniune experience from start to finish and I stil play it a bit here and there after I even beat the game and I am still attempting to mod a bit on it! The pixel work is fantastic myself being a pixel artist! The detail put into them and the stations and enviroment is so well done. The sprites really just kept me hooked for this reason. I also just loved the old school esc feel it delivered to me and its sound track is so nice! A solid single player adventure in space that I would gladly spend 15 dollars to go and relive again as if it were the first time, for a ten year personal project. You guys truely outdid yourselves!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029985509', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1521774709}
review:
Experienced a bug where a space station disappeared from existance. Your job is to taxi people to and from space stations ( the higher paying missions are timed to the nearest second). You have fuel constraints; your reputation is permanent and you can't save the game unless you are inside a space station... so that's a problem.

Love the music by The Kyoto Connection:

https://www.jamendo.com/album/70204/no-headphones-required

http://freemusicarchive.org/music/The_Kyoto_Connection/

This is a 2006 game. The game dialogue is bland, salvaging ships in the dark is a pixelated mess ( imagine someone taking a dump on your screen ). Combat is meh. I wanted to spend more time playing but I reached 2 hours, 24 minutes and the bug is a show-stopper so I must refund. For a second opinion on the game:

https://www.goombastomp.com/indie-snippet-3030-deathwar-redux-double-edged-sword/
developer_response:
Hey CryonicSuspension,

that bug was fixed in our last update. We hope you give the game another shot! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197978624868', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1522110803}
review:
When i seen the way this game was put together I got nostagic goosebumps !  The graphics are nothing short of amazing and top it all of with an epic soundtrack to really pull you back to the games of the 80s and 90s.

Its a mix between Elite, Privateer and Monkey Island !  Would definatly recommend and I wish the developers and team all the success in the future !!

author: {'steamid': '76561198058904597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1934, 'last_played': 1665647573}
review:
TL;DR Do you want a sandbox top-down 2D space adventure game? Do you like a game that offers you the choice of how you make your money, even if the gameplay itself is not very deep? Are you looking for a game that offers different ships, weapons and upgrade options? Do you like the 80's aesthetics with neon lights and 80's-like music? Do you like cheesy writing and playing as a futuristic Indiana Jones?
Then this game is for you. It's basically a 2D Freelancer-lite. 
Moreover, it is the most fleshed out top-down Elite-like game that I've played.

[b]Positives[/b]
+ open-universe
+ story with good character and cheesy writing
+ different career options (trading, mining, combat, scavenging or delivery)
+ different flyable ships
+ different weapons and upgrades
+ good soundtrack (personal taste)
+ neon-80's aesthetics (personal taste)
+ side events and other efforts to make the universe seem more alive

[b]Negatives[/b]
- despite the variety in career options the individual missions tend to become repetitive which makes the game prone to open-world fatigue syndrome
- the game is not hard; therefore the sense of accomplishment becomes smaller compared to something more challenging
- basic loot/rewards
- basic character animations
- minor bugs

Long review below.

[h1]Premise[/h1]
I sunk many hours in the original 3030 Deathwar before development on Redux started. The game has you playing as John Falcon, an Indiana Jones/Han Solo-inspired space pilot who got himself stranded without a ship by dealing with the wrong people. You need to take some jobs and make money to get a new ship and find the guy who double crossed you. But that changes when a bounty is placed on your head for a crime you didn't commit.

[h1]Genre and gameplay[/h1]
3030 Deathwar is a 2D top-down Elite-like game: an open sandbox universe with almost 40 different star systems where the player is free in the way he makes money. You can make money through trading, bounty-hunting, scavenging, mining, package delivery, taxi jobs, and reconnaissance. Or you can be a pirate and blow ships up to get their cargo. Early on when you're low on cash you can do some delivery and taxi jobs to upgrade to a better ship. Scavenging derelicts is a nice option that's been added in Redux. Bounty hunting can be hard depending on your bounty. Though after upgrading my ship's guns, the combat didn't pose much of a threat. Mining can be pretty profitable if you've upgraded your ship to scan an asteroid's contents. I've never dipped into reconnaissance or trading. The latter being because I can't bother remembering or writing down the value of goods in every system to determine what is a viable trade route. The game tries to help you by indicating which wares are expensive or cheap to buy at the station you're in. While the career options are diverse, the gameplay itself is not deep. For me, this made it easier to get bored with the game and put it down for a while. Maybe it was open-world fatigue. After a while all delivery missions look the same, all mining expeditions look the same, all scavenging expeditions look the same etc. 
Which brings me to the part where this game needs attention. The reward system is one area where I see room for improvement. Sure, giving cash for completed missions is fine. But what if there were mission-givers that offer you either cash OR offer a certain ship upgrade (maybe at a reduced price) where you can choose your reward? This gives the player more choice and varies the reward system. The derelicts. They're pretty interesting and you can get some valuable stuff from them, but at the same time the risk of going into one is not high which makes repeatedly looting derelicts eventually become boring even if the loot is high value. I've never encountered huge dangers when going into them. Only some simple critters that attack and can be easily killed.
I think this game can take some valuable pointers from Freelancer. Freelancer had these derelict ships in high-risk areas, which contain high-class loot, like experimental weapons or some extremely valuable cargo. If this game had something like that where there were these small derelict ships in some areas where there was a lot of environmental hazard, then it would make looting them not only lucrative but also exciting. But it must come at a high risk and real danger to your survival, otherwise it will feel like the game is just showering you with overpowered weapons for very little effort on your side. Who knows what that derelict C590 holds? Maybe new weapons for my ship? Proceed to fly into that patch of nebula that constantly damages your ship systems, find the derelict ship, shoot it, recover the items and split out with just enough health left that you can fly to safe port and equip/sell the loot. This makes the exploration more fun as well. 
It all comes down to a balanced risk-reward system and right now the risks are too low and the rewards do not feel very lucrative in my opinion. This leads to the looting feeling repetitive, where even finding a stash of valuable ore won't feel like you've achieved something special. The game's universe is big enough to warrant deeper, more fun mechanics but they're just not there right now which can make the gameplay feel a bit shallow beyond the early-game adventuring. 
The game lets you decide how you play and progress. You can stick to doing the main storyline, which will inevitably have you take on different side missions to prepare you for the next part. Alternatively, you can ignore the storyline completely and roam free as long as you want. There are many different ships, weapons and upgrades. Some ships are geared toward combat, some are more geared toward passenger transport while other ships are suited for trading. The ships have different speeds (both for regular and split/fast travel), turn rates, cargo space, passenger cabins, weapon mounts, turret mounts and missile mounts.

[h1]Music[/h1]
The original game's music has an ambient space-y style that blends in excellent with the game. With the Redux version, the developer added in music from The Kyoto Connection. It is electronic music that has cues taken from 80's pop music with distinct Japanese influences and actually fits very nicely in the overall atmosphere of the game. Good choice from the developer and props to the artists on the music. You can download the music for free from The Kyoto Connection's homepage. There's an option to keep the original 3030 Deathwar's music for those who prefer that. 

[h1]Miscellaneous stuff[/h1]
There's lots of attention to detail in this game. There are little side events you can encounter like Moneyball in which you can participate for a quick buck. There are trade ships that pass by and ask whether you're interested in buying their wares. There's interesting information on certain datadisks in the game which you can buy on stations: some give you tips on how to be a good miner, some are purely there for world-building purposes. There are little details like kicking people on space stations. You can buy a drink at the bars. There's an Easter egg where you can find the game's developers on a station. You can do the Kessel Run. 

[h1]Similar games[/h1]
If you like 3030 Deathwar Redux, then you might also want to look into Escape Velocity: Nova, Transcendence, Flatspace IIk, Endless Sky and NAEV.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166886148', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1667468070}
review:
充滿了90年代音樂、電子龐克風格的太空駕駛開放宇宙RPG遊戲。玩家可以自由的穿梭在不同星系的空間站，完成各空間站的各式委託賺取金錢。或者專注主線，揭開外星人阻止主角到殘骸區域搜刮的原因。

特色：
像素點陣風格畫面。開放宇宙。

優點：
俯瞰視角的飛船操控頁面，適合不善於立體飛行遊戲的玩家。
有趣的故事劇情，時常看反派的3個外星人聊天吐槽覺得好笑。
雖然有限，可是可以在空間站行走和NPC對話取得資訊（雖然只有酒吧）以及殘骸飛船內行走搜刮。殘骸飛船內部的氣氛也相當到位。
音樂很有電子龐克風格。

缺點：
任務面板的描述太冗長，關鍵人物和地點沒有高亮標識，尋找會花費點時間。
初期任務就很容易遇上突然襲擊的海盜。雖然可以通過直接停靠太空站來躲過攻擊。
承上，也因此跑商載客也必須有相應的戰鬥能力。
在飛行模式下操控某些界面時點擊鼠標進行選項的同時也會發射武器，不確定是不是bug。
一次只能擁有一台飛船。（不確定後期能不能解鎖）
空間站及飛船殘骸場景千遍一律。
只有英文。

適合：
喜歡太空題材，喜歡劇情，喜歡開放宇宙，喜歡太空戰鬥，喜歡彈幕射擊，喜歡Elite，喜歡Star Citizen
的玩家。

author: {'steamid': '76561198120548752', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1606102040}
review: Cool game, but I can’t say I appreciate the awkward 90s radio music.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966446818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 1064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1064, 'last_played': 1521818180}
review:
Enjoying it so far.  You can free-lance it, or do the story missions or both.  I'm not too big into stories, so I'm enjoying going off, doing my own thing for a bit, then coming back to progress the story a bit.
Definite retro vibe with the graphics.  Some of the music is really good, other tracks I'm not a fan of, but I can understand how others would appreciate them, thankfully you can turn off the music or config it a bit more to your liking.

Controls are controller, mouse, mouse and keyboard etc - and the dev is really responsive.  Today I watched him respond and upload a test for someone to try out a new mouse only control scheme.

I wish the universe was bigger, or had a random gen mode, but with modding support just added we should see some cool mods to keep it interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022302680', 'num_games_owned': 762, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1709084262}
review: This game is great fun - pure and simple!  Open and freeform, and with more depth than you might think.  Appears to be a great dev team behind it too.. very curious to see what the new modding update leads to in the way of new community generated goodness.  An easy thumbs up!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970543743', 'num_games_owned': 622, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1584826840}
review: From first glance this game doesnt look too good graphics wise, however looks can be decieving. This game has its own style through out from the 80s music to some of the little funny things you see (a dog in a space suit), the writing is pretty good too. The systems built into the game is good from flying to using the map system. Its easy to make money. The stations you visit are visually varied.  This game seems quite polished as well. Plenty of areas to explore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004257299', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1521521292}
review:
This game oozes personality!  

Fun characters, great soundtrack and a great artstyle sucked me in right away.  I also really like the option to blow off the story quest for a bit to cruise around earning cash and exploring before you progress.

If you enjoy Sci Fi and/or the 90's adventure games, you'll probably dig this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977892146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1541684262}

author: {'steamid': '76561198059450946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2210, 'last_played': 1609790604}
review:
Tres belle histoire et musique je m'en lasse pas du tout.

Décollez et explorez cette aventure spatiale unique et passionnante! Open World L'exploration de l'espace, les stations d'embarquement et les épaves, les discussions avec les gens et les échanges commerciaux sur les stations, les tonnes de missions et une intrigue passionnante sont ce qui vous attendent dans cette expérience tordant les genres.

si vous aimez l'univers de l'aventurier de l'espace ce jeu vous conviendra!!!  les dev sont actifs

Le seul reproche serai qu'il ne soit qu'en anglais mais pour ma part me dérange pas.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963273222', 'num_games_owned': 374, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1304, 'last_played': 1519877084}
review: When I just want to veg out and play a game solo this is often my top pic! Game has a wonderful 90's era Lucas Arts feel, 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198429201280', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1522007413}
review:
Awesome game!
Brilliant mix of 90s quests (hey, LucasArts and Sierra;), elite-like space sandbox games (Elite itself, Frontier, Space Rangers, SPAZ etc.) and roguelike shoot-em-ups.
Funny and very addictive story and characters. Protagonist is styled like Indiana Jones))
And... MUSIC. Beautiful synthwave/retrowave/electronic vibes! (you can add your own music as well)

[list][b]You HAVE to buy this gem if:[/b]
[*]you were born in 80s,
[*]you know what "Space Quest", "Monkey Island" mean,
[*]you want to feel those feelings from childhood again.[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198141860626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1563675020}
review: Such a great game!!! and pretty funny as well brings me back to  space taxi and old wing commander some great stuff!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972411754', 'num_games_owned': 765, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 731, 'last_played': 1576369723}
review: This game is awesome and so very reminiscent of 80’s/90’s space shooters and adventure games! The pixel graphics are perfect and really bring home the retro-vibe and the gameplay evokes Star Control meets Firefly meets Monkey Island! While not the hardest or longest game of its type out there, it’s certainly got a lot of content and great gameplay that’s just right and more than long enough for the price plus enough randomization to keep playing long after the main story arc. The amazing techno/electronic soundtrack makes the game really quite immersive and just feels so “spacey” and it makes me nostalgic for my old gamer days playing on my C-64 and my 8088! If you love the old LucasArts SCUMM adventure games or space shooters from the early days of computer gaming then you owe it to yourself to pick this gem up! Worth every penny at full price but even more awesome that I got it on sale! The word needs to get out more about this sleeper because it’s a really shame more people aren’t playing it - it’s THAT good!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001613292', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1521445208}
review:
Also was soll ich sagen.... WOW. 
Ich bin seit langem Elite Dangerous spieler und war auch riesiger Fan von Freelancer und erst recht von Retro 2D Games.
Das Spiel viel mir erst vor einem Tag durch Zufall in die Hände und ich musste es sofort ausprobieren einfach der Neugier halber. 
Erstes Fazit: es macht mega laune. Man findet hier so viele Elemtente aus anderen Spielen wieder, das man sich sehr leicht zurecht finde. Die Entwickler haben für diese Game nur ein minimales Budget zur Verfügung gehabt, daher darf mein keinen Tripple A Titel erwarten. ABER, das was sie da auf die Beine gestellt haben ist es zum Sale, wie auch zum vollen Preis absolut wert. 
Das Spiel selbst ist noch recht jung, deshalb ist es auch nochauf Englisch, doch man darf hoffen das auch anderen Sprachen eingeführt werden und vielelicht sogar noch ein Multiplayer nach dem Vorbild von Elite Dangerous. 
Wie gesagt, es ist 2D, daher bitte nicht zuviel erwarten was das angeht, aber es hat selbst nach meiner sehr kurzen Anspielzeit, totalen Suchtfaktor. 
Die Musik im Hintergrund ist absolut cool, und sie verweisen auch auf die Youtube Streamer, diese zur Not auszuschalten, was ich sonst noch in keinem Spiel gesehen habe. 
Sie antworten über FB super schnell, und am besten finde ich die perfekte integration des Xbox 360 und XboxOne Kontrollers. Da muss man nix mehr umstellen, den das macht das Spiel von ganz allein. 

Respekt und ich freue mich auf mehr davon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005094285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1061, 'last_played': 1521858092}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998220179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1553786611}
review:
Just played 2 hour of this and I've barely explored the system let along the whole nebula! So much fun, so many sci fi references. It's a top down Elite game (buy, upgrade ships and transport cargo/passengers) in the stations along side a Space Questesque side scrolling adventure game with text trees to explore and characters to meet! 

I've not felt engaged in gaming for a long time. The story, humour, world building, openness and depth of this game brought me right into it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970555799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1532900423}
review:
Great little gem of a game. Has that old adventure game feel to it, but also has an open world galaxy, do whatever floats your spaceship boat feel to it as well.
Sound track is really good, and seems to be varied enough without getting overly repetitive. 
Graphics are simple, but the gameplay is good. Gameplay always > graphics in my book.

It's a good game to play when you are feeling antisocial, or just want to take a break from the survival/pubg clone wars.

Unlike most of the games in my library, I'm actually glad I bought this game.

review:
