the game has been done well for youtubers so it has two diffrent soundtracks  that one has not been copyrighted so you can play it on youtube both are awsome . Exploring is so much fun and the humor is brilliant like all 80 space films .so if you likt space and adventure its a game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017606575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 1641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1639, 'last_played': 1615478411}
review:
Very Fun. Totally worth $15.
I would give this game an 8/10

Open world, freedom to go wherever if you plan ahead, controller support (7/10 but it's there and works for 90% of things). There are some things the controller can't do, like take pictures or drop a buoy. You will also need to be close to the screen because there are some things like navigating that are very difficult if you aren't up close to see the detail on the small on-screen map.
The worst thing about it is that there isn't anything else to do once you finish the story. You can still do missions and hunt pirates but once you have a pretty decent ship and figure out the "trick" to combat, you don't need anything else. 

Combat is kind of easy if your ship turns moderately quickly. I found missiles to be completely unnecessary and way overpriced so I just used guns. I frequently attack the Moneyball group and have no trouble killing all of them in less than a minute. That's the biggest challenge I could find and it's pretty easy. Every pilot seems to have the same skill level: LOW. 

There are occasional minor glitches but only one I had to load my game to fix. A station I HAD to go to was invisible except for its gun and I couldn't contact it to board.

Biggest complaints:
Story too short.
Combat too easy.
Controller support is pretty sketchy (the stick moves the mouse cursor when you aren't in combat) and could be improved.
Missions too similar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032699055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1374, 'last_played': 1559964695}
review: Great game! Lots of feelings of nostalgia for classic  1990's adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988167376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 1427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1427, 'last_played': 1519676779}
review:
What a lovely little masterpiece.  I'm satisfied.  What an ending.  

I'm a big fan of Elite Dangerous, but I don't like how little storydriven gameplay it has.  3030 Deathwar Redux edition captures all of that juice which is a space trading simulator.  But in 3030, the hilarious characters and storyline drive you to play further - while still allowing for an acceptable degree of open world freedom, that is to say it is not an empty universe diluting the flavor this game has.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973127808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1171, 'last_played': 1520525930}
review:
Extremely well done space sim, a cross between Frontier/Elite Dangerous, and old classics like Escape Velocity Nova and Flight of the Ring Runner.

Edit: I need to add, that it has some of the best retro music you'll find in a game today. I recommend this game, whether or not it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100355907', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1528664167}
review: It's pretty good. I'm not very far in, but it seems I've seen most of the game already. Soundtrack is pretty good and mechanics are pretty good also. I would wait to buy it when it goes on sale, but that might just be because I'm cheap as fuck.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988709348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1519076216}
review:
If you liked the great adventure games of the 90s and wish they would have had more open word space sim in them, this game is for you.

This game is like I remember the games of my childhood to have been.
The graphics are absolutely endearing and the music is outstandingly good and fitting.
The dialogue is witty and about half of it is irelevant to the game.
Oh, also it has spaceships in it. That part is very cleanly executed resulting in superb gameplay.
10 out of 10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010060761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1507, 'last_played': 1516787042}
review:
Amazing game, has much of what I've wanted in other space games (yet rarely get). Did a bit of everything for a few hours, mining, combat, trading, hauling, etc. 

The 25 hours I played were worth the price, more fun than other games that I've logged more time in. I hope other games use this as an example of good design.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962453326', 'num_games_owned': 683, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1518009156}
review:
I've been following this since green light and keeping an eye on it.. 

Got bored and bought it, expecting mediocore results.  

6 hours in, game feels unfinished like something between missioning is missing.  Salvaging feels good for the first few, but no real risk so far makes it just a cash grab in a hurry. Things get repetitive and same over and over.  The mission banter isn't as great as I expected. 

Somehow I do not feel cheated at 16.99CAD.  I feel the game is a great development jump point to somthing that could be great.  The whole feel of the game is fantastic, I just wish the filler things inbetween wasn't missing that "THING" and i wish i could point out exactly what it is.  

I will continue to edit the review as i go along, but having a hard time staying engaged with it atm, but do give it major thumbs up and recommend ppl watch/support it when they can afford it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277981433', 'num_games_owned': 358, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1766, 'last_played': 1670460927}
review:
(NOTE: This is only my experience, Apollogies if i drifted of somewhere within the review)

The first time i played the game i had no clue what i was doing not gonna lie, and after a few hours i just gave up.

But i recently got back into it and tried 2 ways of playing the game 

1. Abandoning the Campaign
2. Concentrating on the Campaign

-------------------------------------------

This is my experience 
(NOTE: This is only my experience, Apollogies if i drifted of somewhere within the review)

-------------------------------------------

1. Abandoning  the Campaign
Your Free.
You do what you want, how you want to and when you want to do it. 

First thing i did was build up to 100k and buy a ship with decent cargo space. 
(Doing multiple deliveries/ taxi lifts from one station to the next. MORE income LESS TRAVEL)

Afterwards i salvaged DERILECT ships (White Dots)
(CAUTION: There is a chance that you will encouter delerict pirates, THEY WILL TRY TO KILL YOU).
This is a great way to MAKE MONEY and the UNLOCK NEBULA MAP.
Whilst salvaging i also mined for the most expensive products in that system.

In to time i had 300-400K+ which i used to buy the next best cargo ship worth 300k.
With the new ship i had 110t of space and Turrets which made defending against pirates which was a piece of piss.

After that i concentrated on killing pirates and doing bounty jobs where i got 20-60k per Head. You also get to sell the PIRATES bodies which cost around 7k + the cargo they drop. 

At this point i had around 2m worth of upgrades on my ship with which i went to "PLAY" some MoneyBall. There are 6+ pirates playing moneyball at all times with bounties 2-60k+ Per Head. After i got around 800k i bought a ship for 1m+.

OH MY GOD 
I felt like a king, dashin around the vast dark space, sizzling pirates, crumbling asteroids, dominating the different systems.

>>>>>
I enjoyed this style of play alot more because it didnt feel like i was restricted to taking a certain path and i could switch to the different jobs quickly and effeiciently.

-------------------------------------------

2.Concentrating on the Campaign 
Your locked down. 
You do what your told to, you go where they tell you. 

I WILL NOT BE EXPLAINING EVERYTHING IN DETAIL AS I DID BEFORE.
==NO SPOILERS==

>>>>>
The story was wonderfull and some of the plot twist are amazing, you always have a good laugh, especially from the stupidity of some characters. 

It felt kind of pushy as you were always told what to do and at some points especially towards the end of the campaign it felt like the NPC's were uselses as you never got help in battles or recieved  enough funds for the jobs you did.
You do get given a ship at one point and recieve 1.5m compensation after you finish the campaign.


=====================================OVERALL========================
It really is an amazing Space sim, the retro feel and the music drags you inside and makes you feel like one within the game. Hours will fly past when you get into it.

And £10.99 is a BARGAIN 

9/10 

Although i wish there was something else in the game like Larger bounties for pirates, Maybe even a Bounty Show where you could go on bounty hunts and look for different people.

But i feel like this would only work if you were able to land on all of the planets as this would largly increse the exploration and the NPC's in the game which would make it perfect to be a Bountie Hunter.


Im very satisfied with the game what the developers have done with it. 
Simply put its..

PURE

author: {'steamid': '76561198011992222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1517961077}
review:
For those who love sci-fi this atmospheric gem is a great love affair. It's simply blissful to relax to the tunes while roaming the systems taking odd jobs whilst following a tongue in cheek plot and characters enough to keep one going. 

Thank you to the creators of this one, it's beautiful to play, hear, and see.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965472664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1933, 'last_played': 1516324744}
review:
I love this game, I only wish there was more content.

This game is a blast, it sat in my library for months before I finally got into it.
It definitely has that retro feel to it, the music is really good, and the upgrade system is proportional to how long you are likely to play.
Everything is finely tuned to give you a fun 2d space sim experince, and it all works to make a wonderful game.

It's an uncomplicated space sim, perfect for a Sunday!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005879531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 2309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1031, 'last_played': 1523509684}
review:
I can easily say this is the funnest game I've played in the last 6 months.  I've enjoyed other games too, but this game tops the pile.  It takes so many ideas and makes them work well together.  I can't remember the last time I've seen a game with pixel graphics have this level of detail.  

I can't describe this game better than the developer did.  "A fusion of Elite-style space exploration, frantic and fast-paced combat, and a healthy dose of Lucas Arts-style comedic adventuring."  That's exactly what you're getting with this game, and all to a great soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031349373', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1543356877}
review:
Take notes, Elite: Dangerous.

3030 Deathwar Redux is doing it right. Open world? Check. Story? Check. Kickass soundtrack? Check. Space bars complete with rumors? Check. Funny robot sidekick? Check.

Buy it now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027819914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1018, 'last_played': 1514569734}
review:
Скучная и однообразная.
Да, есть открытый мир, есть торговля, миссии, но проблема в том, что это все не имеет смысла.
Корабли отличаются только вместимостью и наличию турели, максимум вооружения для самого навороченного корабля это одна турель, одна пушка и до 10 ракет. Сами пушки отличаются только скорострельносью и наносимым уроном, все они стреляют прямо.
Если у вас есть турель, противоракетная шняга и ускорители, то можно пересрелять всех и все, что можно пристрелить, просто наворачивая круги вокруг жертв.
Основной квест относительно короткий, унылый и поверхностный, никакой интриги, выбора, неожиданных поворотов, просто таскайся между станциями до конца. Местный юмор тож как-то не оч.
Миссии на станциях это принеси-отнеси, постреляй по мусору, прибей пирата, пофоткай планету/нпс в одном конце галактики и отнеси фотки в другой конец галактики. Еще можно лутать останки кораблей, но там мышь сломать можно.
Самый быстрый и прибыльный путь это пиратство - мочить всех и продавать их лут на пиратской станции. Когда надоест - откупиться.
В плюсах только музыка и визуальный стиль.
А ведь можно было сделать, хотя бы, аналог космических рейнджеров. И ведь могло получиться.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031565040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 855, 'last_played': 1609348678}
review: I've never been a big fan of the space genre in general, but what sparked my interest was that the game had the potential of having some slight similarities to the old Sierra Space Quest games I enjoyed as a kid. Although not quite the SQ experience, I've poured a solid 10 hours into the game and I am quite pleased. Have not finished the quest line, but pretty much maxed out my ship/upgrades. I do not anticipate much re-play value, but would welcome additional content add-ons in the future. Would definately reccomend the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990265363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1654726340}
review: Don't Normally do reviews but would without a doubt recommend this game to anyone.  10/10 all round

author: {'steamid': '76561197970849175', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1522245083}
review:
This game has the stuff that Elite Dangerous should have to not be a yawnfest. The graphics are stylish and full of neat details, the missions, dialogues and general humour are fun, the music is great, the atmosphere is all around fantastic and there is lots of stuff to do. 
The developer listens to feedback and the game is constantly being improved. 
Clearly a labor of love and you should lovingly embrace it too!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007290257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1613403680}
review:
Those people who can still remember the good old macintosh games, should still remember "Escape Velocity".  Also the whole scumm collection, like "Day of the tentacle" or better yet, "Monkey Island". Why did I just mention these games? Well just put it simply, 3030 Deathwar Redux is the perfect fusion between these two games.
The humor is like Monkey Island, hillarious and entertaining through the divese dialogues.
The gameplay is just like EV with many improvements. The storyline always tempts you to further explore and forces you to make tuff choices. Did I mention the hillarious easter eggs, like the game Roy from Rick and Morty?

Now as far as the negative aspects go, to be honest, I couldn't find any, other than some minor annoyances. Like you cannot zoom the galaxy or sector map, controller support is a bit dodgy and sometimes the traffic around a spacestation as well as the graphics of the station itself can sometimes be a bit frustrating.

All in all an awesome and fun game. 
I can only recommend it, especially for all those EV veterans ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197961969099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1207, 'last_played': 1541598085}
review:
Loving this so far, got myself a nice big ship after much work. I've done a mix of things including killing pirates, salvaging  ships (Read: Looting, sometimes I get to rescue living crew members), doing taxi/delivery missions and finally mining. 

I'd advise against fiddling with the music selections though as certain choices cause a game crash (Devs seem to be struggling to uncover the cause of it sadly), you'll probably want to adjust the setting that causes a new song to load on changing scenes if you love themusic.

Great effort from two people who are dabbling rather than a full studio release.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989051249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1515273489}
review:
Tutorial is weak.

Im at a loss to what to do or where to go with the beginning of the game.

Difficult map and controls mean I cannot reccommend this as ive wasted several hours working out what im supposed to do with missions and maps and payment.

Music is expecially notably bad too. 12 year old level of music. I thought the whole worlds adult population hated The Frog Song....not having some adults emulate the pisspoor sound that is the Frog Song and put it in a lacklustre computer game.

FUN LITTLE GAME AFTER YOU GET USED TO ITS COMPLEXITY AND LACK OF EXPLANATION.

I still havent found out how to do combat yet.  

u get 4 missiles and thats it...no gun....?

OR much later i get a gun. .. i dont fukn know. The game tells u nothing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964148869', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1107, 'last_played': 1515193041}
review:
If you've ever played EV: Nova or Void Expanse, then this game is for you - it combines a top down open galaxy with a lucasarts style view when aboard stations, to deliver something pretty unique: real character,

The ships are plentiful, with upgrades and new gear all over - the upgrading of ships is straightforward - all the menus are clear and uncluttered, with simple stats and systems. The dialogue is well written and self aware, plus the game has many sci fi easter eggs dotted all over.

Combat is, as with all these newtonian top down games, a little bit hit and miss (pun intended) and seems to boil down to slugging matches and who can dump the most missiles out. However, it's still fun and the world offers you a LOT of ways to make money outside of combat.

Coupled with a fantastic soundtrack and soundscape, this is a fun distraction and well worth the asking price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012395190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 761, 'last_played': 1609486278}
review: I've only played it 8 hours but it is very addicting.  It looks good for an 8 bit game.  The soundtrack is great and enjoyable to listen to on the long voyagers.  It can get a bit repetative with grabbing contracts to go here to there but that seems more realistic to do the daily grind (in space) to earn your way.  You can pile missions and earn money quickly, if you get a tough ship with good weapons you can move onto bounties.   Definately was worth buying on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027867545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1180, 'last_played': 1514771986}
review:
Took a while to learn all the keys and how radar works. But really satisfying once you get the hang of it. I swore a few tims when I go to a wrong station because there are two stations, one with "I", and another with "II". It could be really hard to pickup when you are rushing a delivery under 3mins.

Also, I started playing with controller but end up with keyboard and mouse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029403101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 1571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1571, 'last_played': 1514507103}
review:
A very enjoyable game... but honestly, after you finish the main story, by then you will have scaled up to your favorite ship, the push ends there. After this, there isn't much to do that I can see. It would be great if one could build an empire, bases, or own a fleet.. fight off invasions.. etc... but no.. just the main story and it ends. It kind of reminds me of the classic Monkey Island style games.

Some gamers have raved about the music in this game... I had to turn it off, I found it repetitive and very distracting. Not my style of music at all. Would have been nice to play custom MP3 playlists.

In spite of its slight drawbacks.... 3030 Deathwar Redux is well worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997662673', 'num_games_owned': 2349, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1521154178}
review: Loving this game so far! Go around and do whatever you want in space. There is so much stuff to do. Explore, adventure, combat, mine, jobs/missions/side-quests and so much more. I don't see myself getting tired of this game for a long time. I used to have the old version and this "redux" version is even better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000756362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1521236715}
review: Uneingeschränkt empfehlbares und abwechslungsreiches Weltraumabenteuer mit schönem Soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984468715', 'num_games_owned': 2025, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1513567891}
review:
Not bad, but could have been better. I recommend getting it if/when it goes on sale.

Needs a lot of polish; controls are sometimes awkward and UI needs polish, for example when you bring up your mission list, there's a "show me where" button, but this only highlights the system that the destination is in. You need to then click on that system to zoom into it, so that you can then click on your destination to set it as a waypoint. They really could have had a "add destination as waypoint" button straight from the mission screen. Autopilot also seems to be buggy. You're supposed to be able to press Z to turn on autopilot, but if the autopilot drives near a star, the autopilot "disengages" and there does not seem to be a way to re-engage the autopilot except to quit the game and relaunch it.

The main mission narrative is enjoyable, but there's way too much filler content. The game would have been better if shorter and more focused. Mining is not particularly fun, shooting garbage is not particularly fun, salvaging derelict ships is not particularly fun, taxying and acting as a courier is not particularly fun. Took me about 10 hours to beat the main game, and then another 5 hours to "shoot 1000 garbage", "completel 50 taxi missions", and all the other filler achievements. NPCs also felt shallow. You can do "random chat" with them, or read their biographies, but there's no incentive to care about any of this. Feels like there was a missed opportunity to have them deliver side quests to you.

There's basically 3 classes of ships in this game: traders, fighters, and all-arounders. When you get to the last boss, you can't switch your ship, so I got kind of screwed there because I had to do a massive boss fight in my trader ship. Took several tries and reloads but I eventually got it. Would have been nice if I could have just switched to a fighter ship for that boss fight though -- everywhere else in the game except for the introductory tutorial, you can switch your ships at will as long as you have the money.

The music was both a pro and a con for this game. There's some really nice track that give it that great 80s vibe. The thing is that they chose songs with lyrics, which means the music is very salient to the player, instead of being a background element. This is not necessarily bad, but because there's not that many different tracks in the game, it becomes very obvious very quickly when they start repeating the same tracks over and over. I think if you're going to use tracks with lyrics, you need to "use them once" for a set-piece moment. Take a look at how Saints Row uses the "I Need a Hero" or "Power" songs, for example.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969377624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1513528899}
review: Very enjoyable so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979370112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1226, 'last_played': 1544139426}
review:
Just fantastic.
It knows what it is, and it does it well.
The creators clearly love this game, and games in general. Full of homages and refferences to their favorite games and sci-fi that are done in a tasteful way.
the 2D doesnt detract from it at all and in fact the game is better for it, it wouldn't feel right as a slick triple A title.
If youre a fan of Freelancer style space exploration, trading, combat games, pick it up. Its a comfy enjoyable experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971723987', 'num_games_owned': 394, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1270, 'last_played': 1650597135}
review: Brilliant game! The whole experience reminds me a lot of a blend between old pulp science fiction novels and Cowboy Bepop. Played and finished the main story line. Didn't go slow, but didnt rush it either. Good experience - so good I might wnt to repeat and take it reallllly slow next time!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041402016', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1508966434}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197962301472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 1530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1489, 'last_played': 1660185372}
review:
This is a really pretty awesome game.  If you played Privateer or Privateer 2, it's certainly got some similarities.  Basically instead of a 3D piloting experience, it's top down and kind of gallaga-ish.  There's a lot of ships to buy and a lot of different options, and a crazy lot of stuff to explore and do.

What I like best is that it's a balance of detail and simple play.  A lot of these sorts of games get really overwhelming, but everything was pretty straight forward and enjoyable.  The hardest part (from my perspective) was learning how traveling between space systems work.  Hint: flying into the nebula is really bad :P

My only critique is that the time spent outside of your ship is pretty lame.  It's better than Privateer where all you got was a slightly animated picture and hot-spots to click, but I would enjoy getting to do more exploration of space stations and planets.  Part of the plot is reasons why you can't do this, so I doubt they'll ever take that direction, but "if it were my game..."  That's probably what I'd do :)

So yeah, I would highly recommend this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040190725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1389, 'last_played': 1515295175}
review:
I love this game. It's a 2d Space game with a serious sort of LucasArts vibe and you can do almost anything. Want to mine asteroids? You can do that. Space pirate? That's an option. Just want to run jobs for the local consortiums? Yup, that too. Bounty hunting? Sure, why not? Is there a good story here? Sure is! Do I have to follow it? Nope, it's literally an open world for you to explore.

I've never seen a game like this and it's currently on sale for the Steam Autumn sale. This is the best thing I've picked up in a while and it was dirt cheap and a ton of fun to play. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198346852153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1512444609}
review: After playing this game for a few hours I think it is ok.  I wish the ship control was better ... combat is pretty tough mainly because of the ship controls.  Other space games offer some kind of strafing control but I don't think this one has it.  So far, it is way more lucrative to do jobs and salvage wrecks than it is to trade.  That's pretty much true for every single game that has some kind of economy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992955538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 874, 'last_played': 1505680692}
review: Excellent game, very good music, its fun, its cheap, buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974113872', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1973, 'last_played': 1511958799}
review:
Deathwar is a fun game for its genre and clearly has been a labor of love.  
The dialog has charm and a consistent visual to match.

Some may label this a space trading game- but to me it’s more of an exploring/shooting pirates/mining asteroids/doing missions space game.

I have finished it twice and the second time it was great to see the polish and extra content that was added to the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968078659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1064, 'last_played': 1511716259}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197963559779', 'num_games_owned': 605, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1508023003}
review:
[b]This game is abolutely amazing.[/b]

Everyone should own this game, it's an idie game that just screams in every pore the love and care that went into it.

From the great classic retro music tracks.  The graphics, though pixelated, are more than enough for this great game and reminds me of games like Willy Bemmish and Monkey Island.

Although the story line itself is short the game has an amazing "open world" sandbox feel.  Everyone should give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055294354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1193, 'last_played': 1511289868}
review:
3030 Deathwar Redux its a top-down space exploration and adventure game with space stations on which you can interact with npcs in a way that is reminiscent of old-school point-and-click adventures through its whimsical dialogue. It features a few different kind of missions and activities like bounty hunting and looting derelicts spaceships, however I found the combat to be rather shallow. 
Noteworthy is the games soundtrack which is rather unusual and a cut above what you would generally expect from an indie game, adding to the general atmosphere and the game's character. 
Ultimately this game's strongest points remain in it's story and character interactions, which generally take place in a rather humorous fashion.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990935065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1511533354}
review:
Fun Game the sorta of reminds me of older sierra titles I enjoyed playing as a kid.
- No Lag, Decent Graphics, Good Sound Track
- Developer took in account streamers and reviews in the options menu to turn off any music tracks that could cause copyright issues. 
- Enjoy the ability to be completely free and travel around the game. 
- AI ships bump into you could cause you to get fined.. Not thrilled about that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198329114810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1505698669}
review: This game is a shameless rip off of undertale because it has pixel graphic and mettaton in it I advise no one to buy this game! And make sure that no money goes to the devs dont waste your money on this and buy fnaf instead

author: {'steamid': '76561197995748535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1704754646}
review:
I have just played this game for the last 3 hours straight. IT. IS. ADDICTIVE!! This is one of the coolest sci-fi, space exploration, fighting, mining, scavenging, trading, etc games I have ever played. Wow. And the soundtrack don't even get me started it is absolutely incredible with a lot of voiced songs with a techno/space feel to them. The graphics are really cool 2D and paint a wonderful picture of deep space and space stations. 

The story has just been alright so far, but hot damn every single other aspect of this is amazing. If you are into the outer space setting, and enjoy things like trading for profits, hauling cargo, killing pirates with bounties on their heads, scavenging derelict ships, and travelling a vast galaxy with (with many different ships and weapons and upgrades to buy), then I VERY highly recommend this game. Great job to the team who made it and I REALLY want to know if/where I can buy the soundtrack. damn!

author: {'steamid': '76561197966093580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 1449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1449, 'last_played': 1511221478}
review:
It's ok.  Good music, fun charaters, cool retro graphics.  Some laughs to be had...

Things that could have used improvment: Space combat is rather bland, esp once you figure out you can do a micro jump away from targets and then just blast away in their genral direction while they try to catch up.  I also felt like either jobs didn't pay enough or ships cost too much, it takes too long to upgrade your ship and the best ships are so exspensive you probably won't get them by the time you complete the story unless you grid away....

author: {'steamid': '76561197989939682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 2332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1412, 'last_played': 1523157933}
review: I am constantly excited to be trading, exploring, salvaging, and privateering in 3030 Deathwar Redux.  I love the humor, the music and the skillful visual design of this game, and it just keeps delivering as I explore the galaxy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982584643', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 902, 'last_played': 1508105004}
review:
I really wanted to love this game. Stylistically, it's really fun, and the plot arc is charming.
The classic space-trader-shooter process - getting money, upgrading your ship and getting more money with it - is nicely paced, and the combat is simple but engaging.
But that leads to the first problem: there's next to no combat. Going to a "dangerous" system means there might be one or two pirates hanging out, that you can avoid by just flying to where you want to go. The developers have tried to counter this by adding a menu option for extra fights, but even on the lowest setting this just means a steady stream of hit squads attacking you faster than you can kill them off, even if you're right outside a station in a safe area.
The second major problem for me is the "LucasArts Style" adventuring - there's two of them, with two puzzles between them, one featuring a character who directly tells you how to complete the puzzle. It feels misleading to include one of them in the screenshot gallery.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088657291', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 505, 'last_played': 1597239947}
review:
Rcihtig gutes Spiel. Man merkt die lange Entwicklungszeit, es steckt viel liebe zum Detail darin. Vom Spielprinzip wäre Freelancer ein vergleichbares Game. 3030 ist so ähnlich, in 2D. 

+Witzige Charaktere und Dialoge
+Viele verschiedene Schiffe und Upgrades
+Gut Balanciertes Kampfsystem
+Cooler New Retro Wave Soundtrack
+Interressante Story

Man bekommt die zu besuchenden Orte nicht automatisch auf der Karte angezeigt. Man muss sich an den Texten und Karten selbst naviegieren. Ist ungewohnt, da man sonst überall alles vorgekaut bekommt. Ist nicht jedermanns Sache.

- Aufgaben werden nach einer Weile repetitiv
- Menüs sind teilweise etwas unübersichtlich
- Die Karten lassen sich nicht vergrößern

author: {'steamid': '76561198008453696', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1555208042}
review:
This is a nostalgic game for people who dug old school trading and space combat games. It has a lot of humor and the sprite designs are beyond gorgeous. Unlike the older games this is a throwback to, this has a surprising variety of content with hopefully more added soon. The only downside I can see is that the music is pretty niche, but it can of course be turned off.

I'm a few hours into the game and having played a lot of indie titles I can say this one has legs. It doesn't play like a burned out idea or a half baked money grab, there's a lot of style and passion there that's only possible with devs that give a damn.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973463951', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 886, 'last_played': 1579874103}
review:
Overall a neat, fun little indi game.

The 90`s graffic immidiatly drew me to this game as i grew up with that and I loved the music tracks allthough i wish they would play all the time and not break off when entering stations etc.

Main story line was way too easy and short and the "open world" bit was just shy of being great.
Sometimes it seams shallow, but it proves you wrong.
And sometimes you wish there was more, but there isnt.

But that being said i am very critical to games and a bit of a perfectionist in that regard.

For this price, I recommend this game to anyone in to the 80`s music, 90`s graffic, space genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991018874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3351, 'last_played': 1510295217}
review: Really fun and quirky indi game that is all too short. You can keep playing after the story is complete but there's really no need too. Best got during a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970620042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1429, 'last_played': 1660262578}
review:
It isn’t perfect. However, it is a solid little gem of a game that relies heavily on atmosphere and nostalgia. Truly a work that is greater than the sum of its parts. The elements found within are simple, yet they are used to the full extent of their dimensions. Like a green onion and cheddar omelet made by a world renown chef while the chef is hungover from a night of binge drinking, yet could still make this dish in their sleep. So lets get down to the gritty details.

Pros:  The soundtrack (while slightly fluffy and vapid at times) is quite catchy and will have you bobbing your head as long as nobody is around to see you and question your masculinity. The songs do borrow heavily from many highly recognizable songs from popular charts which will remain unnamed, but they do a good enough job of establishing themselves to be forgivable.

Tons of nostalgia and references to produce chuckles under your breath and make you feel special for knowing the thing that the game is talking about or depicting. You snowflake you! :p

Easy to grasp fun mechanics and controls.

Sufficient career options and upgrades to explore making the experience feel all that more expansive and inclusive.

Decently entertaining story which does a good job of immersing you in it.


Cons: Quests can seem repetitive and boring after grinding for a bit. 

Some elements aren’t very intuitive and feel buggy and/or frustrating at times such as bounty hunting or some elements of travel.


	All in all, this game is a lot of fun and shouldn’t disappoint anybody interested in the science fiction genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076834193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1509177604}
review:
After seeing so many positive reviews, I was impressed and decided to buy since I love just about anything Sci-Fi and leveling up weapons and/or spacecraft (SPAZ, Everspace, Rebel Galaxy, No Man's Sky, Dead Space, Doom). About two hours in, I realized it was going to be pretty monotonous. The game, in essence, is travelling from one mini game to another which can be tedious and annoying, collecting money to upgrade your ship, that can do those mini games better. I find I end up spending a significant amount of game time on facebook waiting for my ship again and again to cross the entire map to get to the next story point inevitably with some variation of the same mini game involved. The mini games include exploring extremely simple, and significantly uninteresting derelict ships (which sounds like it SHOULD be really interesting), hauling junk (literally, in game it's called junk) for NPCs from one part of the map to another for money, providing taxi services for money, and taking pictures of random people who don't have any story impact also for money. I wasn't able to get a refund since I played it just over two hours before trying to return it. I decided I'm just going to finish out the story, not do another unnecessary odd job/mini game within the game, and upgrade the ship and probably won't ever visit this title again. Update: The dialogue and characters are so corny and annoying, I stopped playing and haven't revisited it.

The dogfights are probably the most interesting thing about the game, but that's not saying much. With enough patience, and even with your first ship, you can take down any enemy ship simply by strafing around the enemy and shooting. They'll never be able to hit you with their shots and you can blow up their missles by pressing shift when the missle is in range to be self destructed. That summarizes every dogfight, even if you have 5-10 ships shooting at you - Just strafe, blow up missles, shoot and you win. Simple.

Also, the dialogue is terrible, unwitty, and cliche. Even when the game tries to make fun of itself, it does so in a way that generally isn't humorous for anyone over the age of 10. It makes fun of itself so frequently, I begin to wonder if the developers intentionally put absurd things in the game just to create dialogue that makes fun of it.

I know this sounds harsh, but I just want others to take the huge amount of positive reviews with a grain of salt on this one since I felt pretty disappointed during and after playing through.  The game advertises so many fun and interesting ideas but none have been fleshed out.

Overall, the game is boring, uninteresting, monotonous, and simply, just not a very creative game. If you're still considering getting the game, definitely wait for a discount, or try it and be sure to return it within two hours which is all it takes really to experience just about everything the game has to offer without completing the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971456433', 'num_games_owned': 704, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1636881892}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002240893', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1688289936}
review: Buy it. 'old skool' gamer, really enjoyed this game. So much so this is the first review I've made in 192 games...! Contains many parts and atmosphere missing from games such as Elite Dangerous and No Mans Sky. So much potential too, writers hope to add Mod Support which will really lift it off. Expect it will run on potato's and is a nice little time sink..

author: {'steamid': '76561197989441859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 11235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 4453, 'playtime_at_review': 1026, 'last_played': 1711624973}
review: Outstanding game. Art and sound are interesting and make the galaxy feel alive. The process of completing missions and enhancing ship abilities is consistently entertaining. The writing and lore both painted an intersting vision for a distant-future space civilization that really isn't that different from our present-day. Happy that I bought it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010041386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1807, 'last_played': 1548303801}
review:
Buy it. 

It is a fun game which took me about 24 hours to complete. 
Awesome soundtrack! 
Good game mechanics.
I enjoyed it. 

It just works for me. :)

--

I left the game with the feeling that some parts were a little thin. Nothing serious - the game is good as it is - but there are some aspects/mechanics of the game where I thought: There could have been done a little more with not much effort.

- More ships and more upgrades to them (so you have more time to earn your money for. )
- More variation on weapons. Maybe even multi turrent support? Multi tractor beam? Auto mining plugin?
- The upgrade buying screen ... Why not sorted by type first?
- Option to turn off theese forced dialogues while mining
- Derelicts feel so cool but have not dangers... Hacking the desks? R.I.P.? The squids...? Radiation?
- More mission types and story arcs.
- modding/workshop support

- gfx are a bit dated but add to the charm of the game - don't change/modernize/upgrade it to a "full hd version"!

I would love to get another enhanced version of the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972562146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1535083157}
review: This game is beautiful and fun. It's obvious that the devs have poured a lot of love into it.  The music is awesome to boot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063958443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 820, 'last_played': 1508158771}
review:
To be fair I have not played a ton of hours in this game yet, however I can see myself pouring in many hours more. 

What I have played so far is very unique in terms of style and many of the other space games I have bought and tried have failed to captivate me in the same way as this has so far.

Examples that come to mind are games like X3 which while complex and extremely fun games in their own right, were not as accessible and thus less enjoyable in terms of the initial experience. 3030 Deathwar Redux is certainly a game most will be able to pick up and feel comfortable with in terms of the mechanics.

All in all in an age where big triple A games are becoming ever more diluted in terms of originality and quality small games such as this which aim to take a different approach deserve to be supported.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986081674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1454, 'last_played': 1507924905}
review:
Great indy space game!
Pros:
Great original music
Fun and compelling story
Hilarious dialogue
Lots of great graphical style and funny pop references
Good progression of new ships and upgrades
Decent variety of missions and ways to earn credits
Great responsive Dev community
Very short learning curve, it's easy to jump in and have fun
 
Cons:
Relatively short compared to other sci fi games at around 16-25 hours to beat it, but what's there is really great
No new game + type content, but you can keep playing after you win

Overall it's a great experience, leaves you wanting more because what's there is so good. The only negative thing I can really say is that I hope they get to add more content. Support these devs it's a fun title, and it won't absorb your whole life to jump in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031163057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1176, 'last_played': 1508387588}
review:
A game worthy of dedicating 20 full hours and paying US$ 15 for a job marvelously done, if you are are 30ish and missing those great days and nights playing computer games on a 486 DX4 100 MHz.

The developers have done an OUTSTANDING job in building the retro ambiance. They get you in the small details -- like when you find a floppy disk labeled "Simon the Sorcerer 1 of 3" or something like that. They get you in the big things -- the graphics, the dialogue... and what a great choice of soundtrack!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009452597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 486, 'last_played': 1576209155}
review: This is a very cool old school style game. I love the fact that programmers are making these cool games. So far I can’t get enough of it. It is a bit repetitive but I still love the humor and style of the game.

review: Ever wanta BE Heavy Metal? Here it is!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027478356', 'num_games_owned': 617, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 885, 'last_played': 1541576115}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985788986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1539, 'last_played': 1507358929}
review:
3030 Deathwar is like Elite Dangerous with soul.  The pixel graphics are beautifully low-fi, and the game-play is a mixture of open world style exploration/trading/mining/salvaging/bounty hunting.  Space flight is top-down Asteroids arcade style.  Unlike many open world games, there is a solid storyline, which you can choose to progress or ignore.  Stations and cutscenes are presented in old school adventure game style.  Also chalk full of easter eggs and old school space references.  You can do the Kessel Run!  Lastly, the music deserves special mention.  Several genres of music are represented, many of the songs just put a smile on your face.  

The Good:
-Space game exploration/trading/mining/salvaging/bounty hunting!
-Pixel graphics
-Music
-References

The Bad:
-Can't remap keys.
-???

author: {'steamid': '76561198002401600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1708840048}

review:
Yes, I did a Let's Play on this game. I also happen to be having a great time with it so far. Think of something with the space mission work from Elite, the humor of a Lucas Arts game, and mix them together. Now, add in tons of small touches, and you have this game in the beginning.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974362143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1656, 'last_played': 1506291214}
review:
This is a very good game. Well polished well thought out. I had no issues with the story or the missions and didn't encounter any bugs that affected gameplay. 

Can't fault the game. Was fun to play, was a good blend of the old LucasArts style games and the old retro blasters all crossed with Privateer (which was one of my favourite games back in the day). 

I would like to have seen even more upgrade options for the ships (though there are lots) and more weapon mounts. I found salvaging to be a bit too hard to see what was going on, even with the drone light on. Couldn't find out how to reconfigure keys, which wasn't a massive problem and considering the massive number of shortcuts to menus etc I can see why this may have been an issue; I just kept hitting shift instead of ctrl and would have liked to have swapped their actions.

The story progresses nicely at your own pace which is nice however it does reach a point (near the end) where you a pretty much locked into it [spoiler]because of the un-clearable bounty, you can only dock at 4 stations[/spoiler]. It's nice you can continue to play after the story has finished.

I hope they add a new chapter to this in the future, it deserves more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098279067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1124, 'last_played': 1506213138}
review:
If you grew up in the 80s and love those campy action adventure movies of the decade, you'll love this game.  You'll be drowning in nostalgia.  It not a crazy long story, but it's a good story.  Very fun and funny.  The Sandbox aspect of the game and the map is big enough and has enough depth that there's plenty to do once the story ends.  

The devs seem like really good guys and are very quick to answer questions and update the game.  Feels good to support quality devs on an indie gem like this.

My only complaint is I wish I actually could sell my organs for quick cash :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198041891266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 740, 'last_played': 1506787840}
review: With almost 10 hours under my belt in this game, I can say that it is one of the best new game purchases I have made in years. This is the type of game you're always looking for but almost never find. Tons of depth, interesting story, great pacing, and an astoundingly refreshing balance between all of the different ways you can spend your time in-game. I'm still finding new gameplay aspects to pursue and have been repeatedly surprised by how well everything flows from one activity to the next, along with the fact that unlike most games, I have yet to feel like something's missing or that something should have been done differently (not that I claim to be an expert). Just an all-around great game for a great price. I'm surprised it isn't more popular than it is, but I assume that will change with time. Do yourself a solid and get this game, you won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119862968', 'num_games_owned': 2962, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1505850086}
review:
Elite Dangerousをレトロな2Dにした様な感じで、自由度は高めです。

事故にあって浮遊した宇宙船の残骸を探索して死体あさりをする。
宇宙ステーションで様々な人種の会話を楽しむ。
掲示板からミッションを受注する。（宇宙語みたいなもので書かれたものも・・）
集めた残骸から自機のカスタマイズをする。
等、サンドボックス系のゲームが好きでグラフィックに抵抗のない方は楽しめるかと思います。
ただ、言語は「英語のみ」ですので、英語に抵抗のある方は手を出さない方が良いです。

ゲームのBGMは一部では？有名なケビンマクロードさんの音楽が使われています。
また、TheKyotoConnectionさんの曲も良いものばかり選曲されていますので曲を聴きながらゲームの世界観を楽しむ事ができると思います。

あまり話題になっていないタイトルなので少しでも流行って欲しいです。

author: {'steamid': '76561197986506127', 'num_games_owned': 1553, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1585079747}
review:
Con 3030 Deathwar Redux estamos ante un magnifico simulador espacial donde, al igual que en otros juegos del género como la serie del X Universo, podemos comerciar, minar, cazar piratas, etc. Eso si, a diferencia de la serie X aquí tenemos dos tipos de persectiva: la primera, cuando viajamos en nuestra nave, sera de vista superior, al estilo de otros juegos como The Last Federation o el primer Space Pirates And Zombies, y la segunda, será cuando entremos en estaciones espaciales, bajemos a planetas, etc donde adoptaremos una vista de scroll lateral.

Al igual que otros simuladores espaciales de "mundo abierto" podremos jugar y seguir nuestro propio camino, seguir la historia principal o alternar entre ambas posibilidades. Y es en la historia principal donde el juego nos trae ciertas reminiscencia a las antiguas aventuras gráficas de LucasArts y similares: nos encontraremos con nuestro personaje principal, que guarda cierto parecido con cierto arqueólogo, teniendo que hablar con multitud de caracteres, tanto en busca de información valiosa para nuestras misiones como para simplemente ampliar el "lore" del universo... o para lanzarnos algún que otro guiño friki (el juego está lleno de humor y referencias).

Aunque los sistemas, planetas o estaciones espaciales tienen una ubicación fija, elementos como los campos de asteroides o las naves abandonadas que podemos saquear se crearan de forma dinámica y aleatoria (de forma que el jugador que decida conseguir creditos con la mineria o el "salvamento" siempre tenga donde hacerlo). Tampoco faltan piratas, naves desconocidas y "criaturas" a los que dar caza si nos decantamos por el combate.

Para los que decidan dedicarse al comercio hay gran cantidad de recursos englobados en una economia dinámica con los que conseguir beneficios (típico sistema de "en el sector A el titanio se vende muy barato y en el sistema B se compra muy caro), un buen número de naves (desde pequeñas y rápidas naves para el combate, a grandes y lentas naves de transporte, pasando por naves militares) con sus correspondintes mejoras y actualizaciones. Naturalmente tampoco faltaran los típicos trabajos de chico de los paquetes, taxi, etc, con los que hacer dinero rápido.

En definitiva, un gran juego lleno de detalles, humor y muchas horas de juego si te gusta el género... y no esperas gráficos ultraHD 8k, claro.



Un saludo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035654256', 'num_games_owned': 523, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 4907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1659144148}
review:
I sat down once playing this game... For 3 hours... It felt like I was playing for 6 hours... But not in a bad way... It was SO FUN that it reversed the usual thing. Instead of time flies when you're having fun, this game makes time feel longer and the fun last longer. 

If you love TV shows like, The Expanse, Firefly, DarkMatter, and Killjoys, you will LOVE this game. There are a lot of Rogue space sims like this, but this is the first and only one of them all that I have ever seen truly capture the atmosphere perfectly. It pretty much never feels like a grind and the galaxy is full of such amazing wonder. The whole nebula thing makes split travel so fun. 

I more than recommend this game, if I won the lottary, I would buy a thousand copies to support the developers and then give the copies to people, so that others can enjoy this game. 

I have not found a game that I enjoyed this much in a long time. Truly major props to the developers and I would love to see more like this from them!

*Had to edit this, as I accidentally mispelled Expanse(Expand) as I was just too focused on how amazing this game was*

author: {'steamid': '76561198067773968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1636756089}
review: In a world full of 50$ garbage AAA games i find 3030 deathwar a gem on PC gaming. It doesnt care about min/max but the aim is for having fun on a good story and very odd and unique deep gameplay. Game sound and music are a plus too and blend very well whit the universe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198244501158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1328, 'last_played': 1548733405}
review:
3030 Deathwar reminds me of endless sky (free game, try it ,it's good) only with more story and more fleshed out combat system, The dialogues are fun and the score is good. All in all a nice little space sim.
One complain though, having to complete all your missions to save your game is just tedious and take me out of the game, I get what they were going for but it doesn't work for me and just make me stop playing if there was an option to autosave even with missions it would be great.
Don't let that discourage you though It is a great game worthy of your money

author: {'steamid': '76561197989863500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 2917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1506423271}
review:
A whole lot to like here.

Procedurally generated missions with several varieties available, a well-written main campaign, a fairly large number of systems to explore, and atmosphere that will appeal to folks who remember the eighties.  

There are many ways to play--I started with "taxi" missions within a system, eventually getting enough to run salvage operations on derelicts, then upgrading to a well-rounded ship capable of bounty hunting, then finally strip-mining of asteroid belts.  You need to save your game, unlike most console titles now, but I've found 3030 is fairly forgiving of missteps, I'd have killed me for running out of fuel.  Strongly recommended for sandbox gamers and folks with limited game time.

Pretty good soundtrack, but it begins to get repetitive after ten hours.

A fair number of ship models to choose from but I would have liked more.  The upgrade modules are where 3030 shines; too lazy to get missiles?  Mount a second gun and some maneuvering thrusters.  Love mining?  Get the expensive tractor beam.  Took several hours before I began to see these, but it did not feel like much of a grind.

Some warts and odd design choices--I love the upgrade system but sorting by type or draggable 'modules' would have been more intuitive.  The random name generator gives male names to a lot of female-looking models.  The in-game tutorial is okay but you are expected to figure stuff out for yourself, and some things are just not explained or intuitive, like the "photo missions."  

Overall, a strong title with 50+ hours of play in it for the average gamer, and it is a steal at under twenty bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985471896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1505881942}
review: Fun game, really scratches an itch that is underserved. The universe is a bustling, hustling kind of place you don't find in many games. This game is worth the price and makes every effort to create something unique and organic around which you can create your own path to success within. Really wonderful and lots of fun. Don't forget to refuel! Buy it and enjoy for a long time (I imagine, just getting into it and not sure of the story's length but the structure seems to have alot aspects to explore, engage and exploit). Terrible review, great game. Its like a beefed up Sid Meier's Pirates! in space and a more engaging plot. If that floats your boat, dig in. One issue I had was with the higher resolution not functioning but hasnt impacted my play ( had to reinstall when I tried higher res and fullscreen, oh well)

author: {'steamid': '76561198006066386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1685553975}

author: {'steamid': '76561198262130473', 'num_games_owned': 357, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1528809687}
review:
[h1] 3030 deathwar redux	[/h1]
[spoiler] 重中之重，谁他娘的做的bgm，买到比本体贵我也愿意买阿阿阿阿阿	[/spoiler]

       先说优点：庞大的故事线（垃圾佬主角买飞船被坑然后莫名被追杀，之后找出答案），地图大，这么多星系让你乱跑，飞船、武器和升级选项多得很还有很多任务让你赚钱，细节也很丰富，比如有一次我靠近恒星被烧死了。。。撞到飞船人家还会无线电骂你什么的233

       缺点：没有中文[spoiler] we need chinese we need chinese we need chinese	[/spoiler]，大量的英文文本看着我脑袋痛，要是不出我估计会变成underrail那种被埋没的好游戏，不是undertail，是underrail。其次，敌人开火ai有点迷，慢速绕圈随便风筝。还有就是这个是07年的游戏的重置版，画质比较渣，比如进空间站的时候那马赛克多的一笔，还有进出飞船残骸的动画也是的。

      看宣传动画这个游戏内容是很丰富的，我才2.9小时，还有很多没有探索的，但我现在了解的就是，主角就是个垃圾佬：靠着在空间站打垃圾发家致富，打烂通辑海盗再拿别人货物卖钱，钻进飞船残骸里捡垃圾，具有很强的图吧精神。[spoiler] 话说主角最后捡垃圾捡累了说不定会专门去空间站杀虫呢	[/spoiler]
 
     最后，作为国区第一个测评，我会说这个游戏非常好，但是对英语不好的人也很不友好，不过万一买的人多了人家出中文了呢，先一边玩着一边等吧

author: {'steamid': '76561197975960100', 'num_games_owned': 562, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1458, 'last_played': 1628736936}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995776049', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 889, 'last_played': 1667681456}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027785846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1633, 'last_played': 1505970820}
review:
In many ways this is the game I wanted privateer, elite, solar winds and similar games to be.

It is a rich world(galaxy probably at better word), with some much to see and do.

Thats not to say it is perfect, combat leaves alot to be desired, however I cant decide if that is a flaw or a feature, I mean is the fact that with realivistic speeds, hard controls and agressive enemies a failure in the game or a success in similating what space would really be like.

As I said it is a rich galaxy which feels real.
Dont let the vga graphics and pixel art fool you in many ways this is the most realistic 3X space game I have ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971692688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 1422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1681726655}
review:
Liked Privateer? Rebel Galaxy?

A jobs board, a lounge, upgrade & trading board.

Top down with simple but effective graphics when out in space. Spelling and syntax during dialog shows some rough edges.
You start exploring your system and then you find a reason to have to move on to the next one. You take a breath and undertake a mission in a neighboring system. Oops, you run out of fuel.
Let's try this again.

Where some games needlessly punish you when you are learning, this one prods you in the right direction. 
"Oh, I need to jump to a nearer system and then ferry over to my destination."

You have choices about how you will pursue the game. Trade or fight? Want to be a bounty hunter? 
Follow the story or deviate?


Many games in this niche. This one does it in  a fun & satisfying way.

I am enjoying this so far. I'll update this as I progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998778440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1506027639}
review:
This little indy game stratches an itch that no AAA space sim has been able to for years.

From the moment I started zipping around in my little shuttle, learning all the systems and taking passangers and packages from station to station, this game has drawn me in so deeply. Its graphics and banter are quirky in the best of ways and really make for a surprisingly immersive experience. 

The missions vary and you're able to play all the fun roles you've come to expect from space-faring games. Sure, the missions do get a bit repeatative and some pay out much more than others, but the main story is broken up in a way that keeps drawing you in with every snippet you see. 

The game seems to have a lot going on at first, but it's never felt overwhelming to me at all - even without hand-holding. I recommend using keyboard/mouse controls and taking the time to go watch a 2hr+ gameplay video before buying it, but at the current price, it's so very much worth it. The soundtrack is great, but keep in mind that if you do watch videos online, you won't hear it due to copyrights. 

I'm just getting started, but I can already tell I'll sink an easy 40+ hours into this gem of a game. 

If you like space games and retro design done in a superbly modern way, don't hesitate to get this one.

11/10, I can't stop squashing every bug on every console in the galaxy. 
It's my obsession.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961143961', 'num_games_owned': 3030, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1668995281}
review: If Elite Dangerous had content, personality, and a 2D top-down perspective it would be called 3030 DeathWar.  It has none of those, so this is your best bet for all the things you wish it was.  If you know David Braben, gift him this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022683894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1671438257}
review:
Ich muss den Entwickler dieses Indie-Juwels hier ganz klar meine Anerkennung aussprechen, so viel Liebe zum Detail hab ich selten gesehen, man merkt das hier jede menge Herzblut hineingeflossen ist. Hut ab!

Ganz zu schweigen von den vielen Allusionen und versteckten Details der Pop-Kultur der 80er und 90er, in fast jeder Station gibt es was zu entdecken, herrlich. Klar das muss man mögen, da ich aber in dieser Zeit aufgewachsen bin und es recht gut in das ohne hin etwas schrullige Universum passt das hier konstruiert wurden, kann man auch ohne Hintergrundwissen über diese Zeit bestimmt gut damit leben.

Nach ungefähr 6 Stunden (Offline-Modus wird wohl nicht mitgerechnet) hab ich knapp 1/3 der 38 Sonnensysteme bereist und bin dabei mehr oder weniger geradlinig der Story gefolgt. Wodurch ich eine theoretische Spielzeit von 20 Stunden herausbekomme. Vorausgesetzt ich werde mich nach der Story nicht noch als Space-Trucker verdingen, naja wird wohl eher doch mehr...

Die Auswahl der Raumschiffe reicht von Taxi-Shuttels über Abfangjäger und Mittelschwere Fregatten bis hin zum großen Handelspott, mit unzähligen Upgrades. Da ist für jeden Spielstil das richtige dabei. Zu den annehmbaren Aufträgen zählen unter anderem Personen- und Gegenstandtransporte, Schwerlasttransporte via Traktor-Strahl, das bespitzel von Personen oder kartografieren von Planeten so wie das Zerstören von Weltraumtrümmern und der Klassiker, das Eliminieren von Piraten. Außerdem können noch Wracks von havarierten Raumschiffen geplündert werden.

Mit der Steuerung kam ich nach kurzer Eingewöhnung gut zurecht und dank der Trägheit entsteht ein angenehmes Semi-Realistisches Gefühl der Raumschiffe, vor allem im "Split" genannten Sprungantrieb zwischen den Systemen. Da ich eher ein friedliebender Handelsvertreter bin und äh ja, schon ein alter Sack, kommen mir die Kämpfe etwas hektisch und unübersichtlich vor, soweit ich das beurteilen kann sind aber die meisten Auseinandersetzungen optional.

Also ich bin dem Spiel verfallen und würde es den Entwickler wünschen wenn es noch mehr Spielern so ergeht.

Ganz klare Kaufempfehlung!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992684178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1505171781}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970839531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1505387304}
review:
I am really digging this game.  I am a big fan of 2d space games, and this is a good one.  The thing that sets it apart from others like it is: 
1. Story is not told via menus.  You get out of your ship, walk around in station bars and jet pack around salvage sites.
2. It has parts that remind me of 2d adventure games, like Blade Runner.
3. The story is actually interesting and has funny moments.  Big dose of scifi references.
4.  It doesnt hold your hand but also doesnt need wiki assist.  You can gather valuable info by talking to people in bars or by buying data spread across stations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009120438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1507030804}

author: {'steamid': '76561198011122966', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1505446826}
review:
Not even that much time playing and I already love the character, the atmosphere and the gameplay.
This game simply oozes character and I like the cyberpunk, space theme very well.
The dialogue writing is also well done. It's often comical but not to a level that it's ridiculous or corny.
I can't wait to play more and judging from the game's history, this game really deserves more exposure.
You can tell the devs really put a lot of love and passion in this game and it really shows.
I will still need more time to deliver a verdict on the gameplay loop but this is already extremely encouraging.
I am sold on the vibe of this game alone already!

author: {'steamid': '76561198109612756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3248, 'last_played': 1542832363}
review: This game reminded me of Escape Velocity Nova; a 2d space trader and combat game with inertia with a quest-line, bounty hunting and trading.  The setting will be familiar to anyone who's watched Firefly or Outlaw Star. Fun game that should take 15 hours or so to finish the main plot line.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969483316', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1505689989}
review:
Wow!

This is great - oozes atmosphere - I love the gameplay, really nicely done hybrid adventure/top down space trader title. I cannot imagine the amount of work it took for this.

Just first impressions, but I am pretty amazed. I already wish Adult Swim would hire these guys top build a Rick and Morty game in this style, it'd be insane.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981904472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1505321784}
review:
It's indy, It's fresh, It's Retro, It's everything this Gen X gamer craves.   

I Grew up in the 80s and 90s, back then was the golden age of PC adventure gaming. Star control, space Quest, Star Trek the 25th-anniversary game and many others would keep me and my pals awake till odd hours of the night.  Trying to complete these games in record time, or with better scores, or just figure them out in the first place.  For a long time, I've had the itch to relive that kind of gaming experience. 

3030 Deathwar Redux manages to scratch that itch in a very novel way.   Without the constraints of being too "realistic" or "edgy" or "simulator" oriented, the devs are able to tell a story free from the shackles of having to EXPLAIN the science of it all, while at the same time, reference countless sci fi genre tropes with blatantly in your face easter eggs. 

For anyone who has played and loved Games like Star Control or especially Space Quest, you will instantly appreciate this. 

I have only had a short time with the game, and I can already see myself enjoying the open world space exploration and combat, and the humorous story and dialogue are right up my alley keeping it fresh and fun. 

It doesn't hold your hand too much, you have to figure a few things out as you go, but it does a fair job of guiding you to learning the ropes as you play.  Gently suggesting at the next reasonable course of action to get yourself back on track ASAP. 

It's not a perfect game by any means, and if you aren't into the brand of humor and gameplay it uses to tell it's a story you might not care for it at all.  If all you care about are high rez 3d computer crushing graphics, super easy linear shooters or anything like that, you probably won't want this game. However, had this come out in the 80s or 90s, it would have been a classic that would have shaped a generation of gamers perception of how to do a space sci fi game for the next decade.  

If you still have a soft spot for the old classics like the ones I mentioned at the start, you need grab this game and make a nice hot Tea and sit down on a rainy day and give this a whirl.  For the price of a movie ticket you will have more than your moneys worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004843101', 'num_games_owned': 1493, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1185, 'last_played': 1505832247}
review:
Great game, great devs. (They've even implemented a few changes and fixes I've suggested before). It's one of those rare gems you can't find anywhere else nowadays. Recommended.

Edit: I'm glad I was one of beta testers. I have to say, devs are really friendly, helpful and really care about their game. Making quick fixes and adding some new content and stuff while still in beta. This game really has a potential to become a great game with further development but all of that depends on you people. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197995774748', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 4011, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2161, 'last_played': 1679347700}
review:
If you are looking for a fun open-galaxy sandbox game to play around in, THIS IS IT!
If you are a fan of games similar to Escape Velocity, then you are in for a treat with this one.  
Great visuals, hilarious dialogue, fun story, pop-culture, tons of customization features, this game has it all.
This game is like finding your classic dream car in a junkyard, then having it restored to a thousand times better than original.  The developers have put some serious work and love into this game, and it shows.  

TLDR;  BUY THIS GAME!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968539342', 'num_games_owned': 632, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1505691940}
review: For what it is (mostly pixel art, low budget) this game does it great!  If you are a sci-fi fan you will recognizes the classic influences of this game.  Ive been watching it develop for a while and it has come a long ways and is frequently updated.  For early access it seems to have strong potential.  I hope to see it gain popularity when it is released.  It has the potential to gain a cult following with it's strong story and fun mechanics.  I haven't logged a lot of hours but I do not get the feel it is very grindy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038813966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 3994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1662582097}
review:
